opinion : why it 's good that " we " lost -pipe- germany -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 05.07.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 26.09.2010 home news germany german reunification europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de germany -pipe- 05.07.2006 opinion : why it 's good that " we " lost großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : they 'll get another chance to cheer july 4 is unlikely to become a german national holiday after italy thwarted the country 's world cup hopes on tuesday .
but maybe it 's a date worth celebrating once the tears have dried , says dw-world.de 's mathis winkler . let me admit one thing right away : i 've never been a dedicated follower of fussball .
i do n't know much about the sport and am highly unlikely to become a regular visitor to berlin 's olympiastadion - or any other , for that matter - during soccer season .
a month ago , i demonstratively boycotted the general excitement in the office as germany played costa rica in the world cup opener . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : it looks good on him but silly on grown-ups and then it hit me .
like tens of millions of my fellow countrymen , i caught the bug that let perfectly reasonable human beings run around town with a clip-on mohican in black , red and yellow -lrb- the yellow - of course - is meant to be golden , but for some reason the makers of products in germany 's national colors never seem to get that right -rrb- . but back to that bug .
i 've been watching games whenever possible , working on the appropriate screams and hand gestures that are required of any self-respecting soccer fan .
when i realized that i 'd be spending the better part of tuesday 's fateful semi-final between germany and italy on a plane , i secretly hoped that the airline would - in a grand gesture of patriotism - broadcast the game live in the air . a savi n g grace ? unfortunately it did n't , leaving me to witness the last , gruesome minutes of the game in a bar at berlin 's airport after landing .
heading home on the subway , i watched the train fill with thoroughly depressed german fans . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : c 'mon , guys , it 's only a game i watched a boy slump to the ground and hide his tears behind the black , red and yellow hat he was still wearing .
i watched a young woman stroke a neatly folded german flag in her lap as she glanced at her downbeat boyfriend with worried eyes .
i watched a grumpy teenager in his original german team soccer jersey , who looked like he was ready to punch someone until his father told him to look at an advertisement on the window behind him . " jesus rettet , " it read .
jesus saves . germa n y 's lesso n the teen chuckled and suddenly it dawned on me .
while germany 's fourth of july might have been incredibly painful , it could teach the country a lesson that 's much more important than winning the world cup . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : even michael ballack could n't help but cry which lesson ?
that it 's okay to lose , especially after giving it your best - both on the pitch and on the streets .
that germans seem to have won something that 's much more important than the short-lived joy of a weltmeister title : the ability to celebrate their team and their country without making others feel threatened by a new-found , friendly patriotism . last night , the streets fell silent .
they lacked the honking concerts that followed the recent victories of germany 's soccer team .
but this morning , the black , red and yellow flags were still flying atop cars and germans were looking forward to cheering for their guys in their final world cup game for third place on saturday . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : unlikely to disappear from germany 's streets any time soon " now more than ever , " read the shirt that one tv commentator put on after tuesday 's match .
he praised " our " performance and said that germany 's young team has a bright future ahead . as far as i know , the european championships are coming up in 2008 .
let 's try that for starters .
i 'll be watching .
and i 'll keep my fingers crossed . mathis winkler send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de press review : chin up , germany european editorials on wednesday commented on germany 's dramatic loss to italy in tuesday 's world cup semi-final match , with most papers giving germany a sympathetic pat on the back for a job well done .
-lrb- june 5 , 2006 -rrb- german politicians hail new patriotism the self-confidence shown by germans at the world cup is an expression of a new and healthy patriotism , according to several politicians .
the catholic church has welcomed a " commitment to our country . "
-lrb- june 18 , 2006 -rrb- the world cup is over for germany but the party must continue hosts germany are out of the world cup after losing to italy .
the whole country goes into mourning but dw-world.de believes germany still has plenty to celebrate even though the dream is now over .
-lrb- july 4 , 2006 -rrb- feedback do you think that germans have a reason to celebrate despite tuesday 's loss ?
please include your name and country in your reply .

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de germany -pipe- 05.07.2006 opinion : why it 's good that " we " lost großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : they 'll get another chance to cheer july 4 is unlikely to become a german national holiday after italy thwarted the country 's world cup hopes on tuesday .

heading home on the subway , i watched the train fill with thoroughly depressed german fans . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : c 'mon , guys , it 's only a game i watched a boy slump to the ground and hide his tears behind the black , red and yellow hat he was still wearing .
i watched a young woman stroke a neatly folded german flag in her lap as she glanced at her downbeat boyfriend with worried eyes .
i watched a grumpy teenager in his original german team soccer jersey , who looked like he was ready to punch someone until his father told him to look at an advertisement on the window behind him . " jesus rettet , " it read .
jesus saves . germa n y 's lesso n the teen chuckled and suddenly it dawned on me .

they lacked the honking concerts that followed the recent victories of germany 's soccer team .
but this morning , the black , red and yellow flags were still flying atop cars and germans were looking forward to cheering for their guys in their final world cup game for third place on saturday . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : unlikely to disappear from germany 's streets any time soon " now more than ever , " read the shirt that one tv commentator put on after tuesday 's match .
he praised " our " performance and said that germany 's young team has a bright future ahead . as far as i know , the european championships are coming up in 2008 .
let 's try that for starters .
i 'll be watching .
and i 'll keep my fingers crossed . mathis winkler send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de press review : chin up , germany european editorials on wednesday commented on germany 's dramatic loss to italy in tuesday 's world cup semi-final match , with most papers giving germany a sympathetic pat on the back for a job well done .

the catholic church has welcomed a " commitment to our country . "

but maybe it 's a date worth celebrating once the tears have dried , says dw-world.de 's mathis winkler . let me admit one thing right away : i 've never been a dedicated follower of fussball .
i do n't know much about the sport and am highly unlikely to become a regular visitor to berlin 's olympiastadion - or any other , for that matter - during soccer season .
a month ago , i demonstratively boycotted the general excitement in the office as germany played costa rica in the world cup opener . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : it looks good on him but silly on grown-ups and then it hit me .
like tens of millions of my fellow countrymen , i caught the bug that let perfectly reasonable human beings run around town with a clip-on mohican in black , red and yellow -lrb- the yellow - of course - is meant to be golden , but for some reason the makers of products in germany 's national colors never seem to get that right -rrb- . but back to that bug .
i 've been watching games whenever possible , working on the appropriate screams and hand gestures that are required of any self-respecting soccer fan .
when i realized that i 'd be spending the better part of tuesday 's fateful semi-final between germany and italy on a plane , i secretly hoped that the airline would - in a grand gesture of patriotism - broadcast the game live in the air . a savi n g grace ? unfortunately it did n't , leaving me to witness the last , gruesome minutes of the game in a bar at berlin 's airport after landing .
heading home on the subway , i watched the train fill with thoroughly depressed german fans . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : c 'mon , guys , it 's only a game i watched a boy slump to the ground and hide his tears behind the black , red and yellow hat he was still wearing .
i watched a young woman stroke a neatly folded german flag in her lap as she glanced at her downbeat boyfriend with worried eyes .
i watched a grumpy teenager in his original german team soccer jersey , who looked like he was ready to punch someone until his father told him to look at an advertisement on the window behind him . " jesus rettet , " it read .
jesus saves . germa n y 's lesso n the teen chuckled and suddenly it dawned on me .
while germany 's fourth of july might have been incredibly painful , it could teach the country a lesson that 's much more important than winning the world cup . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : even michael ballack could n't help but cry which lesson ?
that it 's okay to lose , especially after giving it your best - both on the pitch and on the streets .
that germans seem to have won something that 's much more important than the short-lived joy of a weltmeister title : the ability to celebrate their team and their country without making others feel threatened by a new-found , friendly patriotism . last night , the streets fell silent .
they lacked the honking concerts that followed the recent victories of germany 's soccer team .
but this morning , the black , red and yellow flags were still flying atop cars and germans were looking forward to cheering for their guys in their final world cup game for third place on saturday . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : unlikely to disappear from germany 's streets any time soon " now more than ever , " read the shirt that one tv commentator put on after tuesday 's match .
he praised " our " performance and said that germany 's young team has a bright future ahead . as far as i know , the european championships are coming up in 2008 .
let 's try that for starters .
i 'll be watching .
and i 'll keep my fingers crossed . mathis winkler send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de press review : chin up , germany european editorials on wednesday commented on germany 's dramatic loss to italy in tuesday 's world cup semi-final match , with most papers giving germany a sympathetic pat on the back for a job well done .
-lrb- june 5 , 2006 -rrb- german politicians hail new patriotism the self-confidence shown by germans at the world cup is an expression of a new and healthy patriotism , according to several politicians .
the catholic church has welcomed a " commitment to our country . "
-lrb- june 18 , 2006 -rrb- the world cup is over for germany but the party must continue hosts germany are out of the world cup after losing to italy .
the whole country goes into mourning but dw-world.de believes germany still has plenty to celebrate even though the dream is now over .
-lrb- july 4 , 2006 -rrb- 9801 radio news listen to world headlines from the top of the hour .

eu must stay open , finland says as it takes over reins -pipe- europe -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 05.07.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 28.09.2010 home news germany europe map world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de in focus : the german eu presidency a dummy 's guide to the eu german fm : kosovo biggest problem right now commission proposes eu-wide green card for migrants germany determined to strengthen european police agency europe -pipe- 05.07.2006 eu must stay open , finland says as it takes over reins großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : we are not at a dead end , finland says finland , which took over the reins of the eu july 1 , says the 25-member bloc must keep their doors open to new members . in spite of concerns by eu members over enlargement fatigue , finnish premier matti vanhanen said on wednesday that keeping the bloc open to future members was one priority of his six-month term . " not only is enlargement a key tool for strengthening stability and democracy but it is also one of the strategic responses to the challenges of globalization , " vanhanen told the european parliament .
" the eu must continue to be an open union .
european countries that fulfill the membership criteria must have the possibility to join . " in outlining the priorities , vanhanen departed from finland 's predecessor , austria , who was less than enthusiastic over turkey 's bid for membership .
austria wanted to limit the size of the eu and wanted its ability to absorb new members to become a decisive issue for future candidates . opposition to enlargement is seen as a key factor in the unsuccessful referendums over the draft constitution in france and the netherlands last year . pushi n g o n with the co n stitutio n in addition to consulting with other eu members on the constitution and pushing for its ratification in finland this year , the finnish leader said that it is necessary to move forward with other internal initiatives to reform the eu 's decision-making processes . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : finland 's prime minister , matti vanhanen says that he wants to bring back latin " during our presidency , we will try to look outwards and inwards , " he said .
" i do n't agree with pessimistic speeches about the crisis in the eu .
i believe the current problems can be overcome . "
for example , vanhanen wants more integration in policing and in the judiciary by using a special legal procedure to shift these policies to another level of decision-making , with more powers for the european commission and parliament and less unanimous voting among member states .
" there may be something of a wait-and-see mood in the union , but the world around us is not going to stop and wait , " he said .
" we would be doing future generations of europeans a great disservice if we were simply to shut our eyes to the historic challenges that we face and wait for better times to come . " closer ties with russia other priorities that vanhanen outlined were closer cooperation with russia , pushing through legislative packages such as the chemical law reach and the services directive .
he also pledged more openness in the ministerial meetings as agreed to at the eu summit last june . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : closer ties with the kremlin are a priority one concrete proposal that finland is already pushing is a tax increase on alcohol across the eu .
the topic is already on the agenda for meetings next week . " it is necessary to harmonize the tax rates to even out the price levels of alcohol , " finland said in a press release .
another initiative , considered a bit far out by some , is to publish weekly eu news bulletins in latin on its website every wednesday . the new eu president will also have its hands full with a few tricky issues .
one is a growing dispute between eu member cyprus and candidate turkey .
cyprus wants turkey to open its ports and airspace to their ships and planes . vanhanen said that turkey will be dealt with " openly and honestly " but that is has a " long and bumpy " road ahead in fulfilling membership criteria . no more backslappi n g some eu parliamentarians welcomed the initiatives as a good sign of things to come . " we need the constitution , " martin schulz , a german social democrat , told dpa news service of the push to revive the instrument . on russia , there was more dissent . " we need a stabile partnership with russia , but let 's finish now with the backslapping , " hans-gert pöttering , a german christian democratic eu parliamentarian told dpa , referring to human rights concerns over russia . dw staff -lrb- jb -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de austria hands eu baton to finland on saturday , austria hands over the presidency of the european union to finland .
the alpine republic declared some lofty goals during its time at the top , but to what extent did it deliver ?
-lrb- june 30 , 2006 -rrb- eu leaders postpone constitution decision until 2008 european union leaders on friday left the bloc 's moribund constitution in limbo until 2008 and set tougher terms for the admission of new member states to the 25-nation bloc .
-lrb- june 16 , 2006 -rrb- eu takes stock of cloudy future the eu admitted thursday there would be no " miracles " as it battles to revive its fortunes at a morose summit clouded by institutional limbo and growing doubts over enlargement plans .
-lrb- june 16 , 2006 -rrb- audios and videos on the topic finland sets a real example for other european countries as one of the most prosperous and competitive countries in europe .
and they lead most significantly in providing an effective education system and care for their children .
finland has just taken over the eu presidency and they have a lot on their plate in this crisis-filled time .
but they believe they can successfully tackle issues and move the eu forward .
feedback what do you think of the finnish plans ?
please include your name and country in your reply .

zidane 's penalty decides nervous semi as france make final -pipe- match reports -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 05.07.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 26.03.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de in focus : the road to the final two late extra-time goals kill off germany 's world cup dream three off in pulsating but bad tempered us , italy 1-1 draw italy make light work of ukraine to meet hosts in semi-finals us out of world cup while ghana , italy reach next round match reports -pipe- 05.07.2006 zidane 's penalty decides nervous semi as france make final großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : i 'm not finished just yet : zidane 's penalty ensures the french captain gets a final send-off in comparison to the classic match the night before , france and portugal played out a nervy semi-final in munich with few clear chances .
zinedine zidane 's penalty was enough to put france in sunday 's final against italy . zinedine zidane fired france into their second world cup final appearance in eight years in munich on wednesday , scoring the only goal in a 1-0 semi-final victory over portugal . the french captain shattered portugal 's dreams of a first ever appearance in the final after coolly converting a hotly disputed penalty midway through the first half at the 62,000-seat allianz arena . zidane 's goal was a repeat of his spot-kick winner against the portuguese in the semi-finals of euro 2000 and sent france into a final on sunday against italy - just as it had done six years ago . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : ricardo picked the right side but could n't stop zizou scoring but the decider was shrouded in controversy , with portugal protesting uruguayan referee jorge larrionda 's decision to point to the spot after chelsea defender ricardo carvalho brought down thierry henry just inside the area . a clever touch by henry wrong-footed carvalho who fell but stuck his leg out , and although the arsenal star reacted theatrically to clear contact , larrionda had no hesitation in pointing to the spot . portuguese goalkeeper ricardo had saved three penalties in his side 's shoot-out victory over england in the quarter-finals on saturday but though he dived the right way zidane 's 33rd-minute spot kick gave him no chance , buried majestically into the corner . france , the 1998 champions , spent much of the remainder of the game on the back foot as portugal searched desperately for an equalizer . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : portugal 's former galactico figo was shut out but despite dominating territory and possession much of the second half , portugal were unable to find a way through a french defense superbly marshaled by lilian thuram and william gallas . luis figo missed a glorious chance to equalize when he headed over on 78 minutes after a cristiano ronaldo free-kick that french keeper fabien barthez spilled comically . a furious late rally saw portugal camped in french territory but les bleus held firm to keep their dream of a second title alive . the match had threatened to boil over towards the end of the first half when portugal had a penalty appeal of their own waved away . ronaldo - booed whenever he touched the ball in the first half - leapt for a cross and fell over french defender willy sagnol . portugal coach luiz felipe scolari and the entire portugal bench were out of the dug-out in protest but referee larrionda was having none of it , and replays showed there was no contact whatsoever . an entertaining opening 45 minutes saw both sides go close early on ; dispelling fears the match would be a tense affair with five players from each team starting on a yellow card . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : there were few clear chances in the tight game portugal , who had welcomed the return from suspension of midfield enforcer costinha and barcelona playmaker deco , were quickly into their stride with ronaldo looking menacing down the left . both deco and figo forced barthez into scrambled saves in the opening 15 minutes , while midfielder maniche saw a shot fly millimeters over the bar . yet though portugal had the clearer chances , france did not appear to be unduly troubled , their back four restricting their opponents to long-range efforts only . ronaldo , who has been demonized in england this week for his part in the dismissal of wayne rooney last weekend , was singled out as the pantomime villain by french and neutral fans immediately . boos and whistles greeted the manchester united winger 's every touch and he enraged france coach raymond domenech on the half-hour , the french coach accusing him of attempting to con the referee with a dive . dw staff -lrb- nda -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de zinedine zidane : the making of a soccer legend it started in a marseille ghetto before weaving its way through europe , gathering riches on the way .
the story of zinedine zidane 's soccer journey could become the greatest ever told if it ends with a second world cup .
-lrb- july 5 , 2006 -rrb- magical zizou ready to cast spell over portuguese men of war the masterful zinedine zidane and a resurgent france aim to make it unlucky number 13 for portugal coach luiz felipe scolari in the world cup semi-final in munich on wednesday .
-lrb- july 5 , 2006 -rrb- live ticker : portugal 0:1 france review all the action as it happened on dw-world.de 's live ticker .

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de in focus : the road to the final two late extra-time goals kill off germany 's world cup dream three off in pulsating but bad tempered us , italy 1-1 draw italy make light work of ukraine to meet hosts in semi-finals us out of world cup while ghana , italy reach next round match reports -pipe- 05.07.2006 zidane 's penalty decides nervous semi as france make final großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : i 'm not finished just yet : zidane 's penalty ensures the french captain gets a final send-off in comparison to the classic match the night before , france and portugal played out a nervy semi-final in munich with few clear chances .
zinedine zidane 's penalty was enough to put france in sunday 's final against italy . zinedine zidane fired france into their second world cup final appearance in eight years in munich on wednesday , scoring the only goal in a 1-0 semi-final victory over portugal . the french captain shattered portugal 's dreams of a first ever appearance in the final after coolly converting a hotly disputed penalty midway through the first half at the 62,000-seat allianz arena . zidane 's goal was a repeat of his spot-kick winner against the portuguese in the semi-finals of euro 2000 and sent france into a final on sunday against italy - just as it had done six years ago . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : ricardo picked the right side but could n't stop zizou scoring but the decider was shrouded in controversy , with portugal protesting uruguayan referee jorge larrionda 's decision to point to the spot after chelsea defender ricardo carvalho brought down thierry henry just inside the area . a clever touch by henry wrong-footed carvalho who fell but stuck his leg out , and although the arsenal star reacted theatrically to clear contact , larrionda had no hesitation in pointing to the spot . portuguese goalkeeper ricardo had saved three penalties in his side 's shoot-out victory over england in the quarter-finals on saturday but though he dived the right way zidane 's 33rd-minute spot kick gave him no chance , buried majestically into the corner . france , the 1998 champions , spent much of the remainder of the game on the back foot as portugal searched desperately for an equalizer . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : portugal 's former galactico figo was shut out but despite dominating territory and possession much of the second half , portugal were unable to find a way through a french defense superbly marshaled by lilian thuram and william gallas . luis figo missed a glorious chance to equalize when he headed over on 78 minutes after a cristiano ronaldo free-kick that french keeper fabien barthez spilled comically . a furious late rally saw portugal camped in french territory but les bleus held firm to keep their dream of a second title alive . the match had threatened to boil over towards the end of the first half when portugal had a penalty appeal of their own waved away . ronaldo - booed whenever he touched the ball in the first half - leapt for a cross and fell over french defender willy sagnol . portugal coach luiz felipe scolari and the entire portugal bench were out of the dug-out in protest but referee larrionda was having none of it , and replays showed there was no contact whatsoever . an entertaining opening 45 minutes saw both sides go close early on ; dispelling fears the match would be a tense affair with five players from each team starting on a yellow card . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : there were few clear chances in the tight game portugal , who had welcomed the return from suspension of midfield enforcer costinha and barcelona playmaker deco , were quickly into their stride with ronaldo looking menacing down the left . both deco and figo forced barthez into scrambled saves in the opening 15 minutes , while midfielder maniche saw a shot fly millimeters over the bar . yet though portugal had the clearer chances , france did not appear to be unduly troubled , their back four restricting their opponents to long-range efforts only . ronaldo , who has been demonized in england this week for his part in the dismissal of wayne rooney last weekend , was singled out as the pantomime villain by french and neutral fans immediately . boos and whistles greeted the manchester united winger 's every touch and he enraged france coach raymond domenech on the half-hour , the french coach accusing him of attempting to con the referee with a dive . dw staff -lrb- nda -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de zinedine zidane : the making of a soccer legend it started in a marseille ghetto before weaving its way through europe , gathering riches on the way .
the story of zinedine zidane 's soccer journey could become the greatest ever told if it ends with a second world cup .
-lrb- july 5 , 2006 -rrb- magical zizou ready to cast spell over portuguese men of war the masterful zinedine zidane and a resurgent france aim to make it unlucky number 13 for portugal coach luiz felipe scolari in the world cup semi-final in munich on wednesday .
-lrb- july 5 , 2006 -rrb- live ticker : portugal 0:1 france review all the action as it happened on dw-world.de 's live ticker .
www-links dw-world.de : the 2006 world cup news , match reports , previews and features from the 2006 world cup in germany .
feedback send us an e-mail .
please include your name and country in your reply .

zidane 's penalty decides nervous semi as france make final -pipe- match reports -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 05.07.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 10.11.2010 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de in focus : the road to the final two late extra-time goals kill off germany 's world cup dream three off in pulsating but bad tempered us , italy 1-1 draw italy make light work of ukraine to meet hosts in semi-finals us out of world cup while ghana , italy reach next round match reports -pipe- 05.07.2006 zidane 's penalty decides nervous semi as france make final großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : i 'm not finished just yet : zidane 's penalty ensures the french captain gets a final send-off in comparison to the classic match the night before , france and portugal played out a nervy semi-final in munich with few clear chances .
zinedine zidane 's penalty was enough to put france in sunday 's final against italy . zinedine zidane fired france into their second world cup final appearance in eight years in munich on wednesday , scoring the only goal in a 1-0 semi-final victory over portugal . the french captain shattered portugal 's dreams of a first ever appearance in the final after coolly converting a hotly disputed penalty midway through the first half at the 62,000-seat allianz arena . zidane 's goal was a repeat of his spot-kick winner against the portuguese in the semi-finals of euro 2000 and sent france into a final on sunday against italy - just as it had done six years ago . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : ricardo picked the right side but could n't stop zizou scoring but the decider was shrouded in controversy , with portugal protesting uruguayan referee jorge larrionda 's decision to point to the spot after chelsea defender ricardo carvalho brought down thierry henry just inside the area . a clever touch by henry wrong-footed carvalho who fell but stuck his leg out , and although the arsenal star reacted theatrically to clear contact , larrionda had no hesitation in pointing to the spot . portuguese goalkeeper ricardo had saved three penalties in his side 's shoot-out victory over england in the quarter-finals on saturday but though he dived the right way zidane 's 33rd-minute spot kick gave him no chance , buried majestically into the corner . france , the 1998 champions , spent much of the remainder of the game on the back foot as portugal searched desperately for an equalizer . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : portugal 's former galactico figo was shut out but despite dominating territory and possession much of the second half , portugal were unable to find a way through a french defense superbly marshaled by lilian thuram and william gallas . luis figo missed a glorious chance to equalize when he headed over on 78 minutes after a cristiano ronaldo free-kick that french keeper fabien barthez spilled comically . a furious late rally saw portugal camped in french territory but les bleus held firm to keep their dream of a second title alive . the match had threatened to boil over towards the end of the first half when portugal had a penalty appeal of their own waved away . ronaldo - booed whenever he touched the ball in the first half - leapt for a cross and fell over french defender willy sagnol . portugal coach luiz felipe scolari and the entire portugal bench were out of the dug-out in protest but referee larrionda was having none of it , and replays showed there was no contact whatsoever . an entertaining opening 45 minutes saw both sides go close early on ; dispelling fears the match would be a tense affair with five players from each team starting on a yellow card . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : there were few clear chances in the tight game portugal , who had welcomed the return from suspension of midfield enforcer costinha and barcelona playmaker deco , were quickly into their stride with ronaldo looking menacing down the left . both deco and figo forced barthez into scrambled saves in the opening 15 minutes , while midfielder maniche saw a shot fly millimeters over the bar . yet though portugal had the clearer chances , france did not appear to be unduly troubled , their back four restricting their opponents to long-range efforts only . ronaldo , who has been demonized in england this week for his part in the dismissal of wayne rooney last weekend , was singled out as the pantomime villain by french and neutral fans immediately . boos and whistles greeted the manchester united winger 's every touch and he enraged france coach raymond domenech on the half-hour , the french coach accusing him of attempting to con the referee with a dive . dw staff -lrb- nda -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de zinedine zidane : the making of a soccer legend it started in a marseille ghetto before weaving its way through europe , gathering riches on the way .

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de in focus : the road to the final two late extra-time goals kill off germany 's world cup dream three off in pulsating but bad tempered us , italy 1-1 draw italy make light work of ukraine to meet hosts in semi-finals us out of world cup while ghana , italy reach next round match reports -pipe- 05.07.2006 zidane 's penalty decides nervous semi as france make final großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : i 'm not finished just yet : zidane 's penalty ensures the french captain gets a final send-off in comparison to the classic match the night before , france and portugal played out a nervy semi-final in munich with few clear chances .
zinedine zidane 's penalty was enough to put france in sunday 's final against italy . zinedine zidane fired france into their second world cup final appearance in eight years in munich on wednesday , scoring the only goal in a 1-0 semi-final victory over portugal . the french captain shattered portugal 's dreams of a first ever appearance in the final after coolly converting a hotly disputed penalty midway through the first half at the 62,000-seat allianz arena . zidane 's goal was a repeat of his spot-kick winner against the portuguese in the semi-finals of euro 2000 and sent france into a final on sunday against italy - just as it had done six years ago . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : ricardo picked the right side but could n't stop zizou scoring but the decider was shrouded in controversy , with portugal protesting uruguayan referee jorge larrionda 's decision to point to the spot after chelsea defender ricardo carvalho brought down thierry henry just inside the area . a clever touch by henry wrong-footed carvalho who fell but stuck his leg out , and although the arsenal star reacted theatrically to clear contact , larrionda had no hesitation in pointing to the spot . portuguese goalkeeper ricardo had saved three penalties in his side 's shoot-out victory over england in the quarter-finals on saturday but though he dived the right way zidane 's 33rd-minute spot kick gave him no chance , buried majestically into the corner . france , the 1998 champions , spent much of the remainder of the game on the back foot as portugal searched desperately for an equalizer . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : portugal 's former galactico figo was shut out but despite dominating territory and possession much of the second half , portugal were unable to find a way through a french defense superbly marshaled by lilian thuram and william gallas . luis figo missed a glorious chance to equalize when he headed over on 78 minutes after a cristiano ronaldo free-kick that french keeper fabien barthez spilled comically . a furious late rally saw portugal camped in french territory but les bleus held firm to keep their dream of a second title alive . the match had threatened to boil over towards the end of the first half when portugal had a penalty appeal of their own waved away . ronaldo - booed whenever he touched the ball in the first half - leapt for a cross and fell over french defender willy sagnol . portugal coach luiz felipe scolari and the entire portugal bench were out of the dug-out in protest but referee larrionda was having none of it , and replays showed there was no contact whatsoever . an entertaining opening 45 minutes saw both sides go close early on ; dispelling fears the match would be a tense affair with five players from each team starting on a yellow card . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : there were few clear chances in the tight game portugal , who had welcomed the return from suspension of midfield enforcer costinha and barcelona playmaker deco , were quickly into their stride with ronaldo looking menacing down the left . both deco and figo forced barthez into scrambled saves in the opening 15 minutes , while midfielder maniche saw a shot fly millimeters over the bar . yet though portugal had the clearer chances , france did not appear to be unduly troubled , their back four restricting their opponents to long-range efforts only . ronaldo , who has been demonized in england this week for his part in the dismissal of wayne rooney last weekend , was singled out as the pantomime villain by french and neutral fans immediately . boos and whistles greeted the manchester united winger 's every touch and he enraged france coach raymond domenech on the half-hour , the french coach accusing him of attempting to con the referee with a dive . dw staff -lrb- nda -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de zinedine zidane : the making of a soccer legend it started in a marseille ghetto before weaving its way through europe , gathering riches on the way .

just as it had done six years ago . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : ricardo picked the right side but could n't stop zizou scoring but the decider was shrouded in controversy , with portugal protesting uruguayan referee jorge larrionda 's decision to point to the spot after chelsea defender ricardo carvalho brought down thierry henry just inside the area . a clever touch by henry wrong-footed carvalho who fell but stuck his leg out , and although the arsenal star reacted theatrically to clear contact , larrionda had no hesitation in pointing to the spot . portuguese goalkeeper ricardo had saved three penalties in his side 's shoot-out victory over england in the quarter-finals on saturday but though he dived the right way zidane 's 33rd-minute spot kick gave him no chance , buried majestically into the corner . france , the 1998 champions , spent much of the remainder of the game on the back foot as portugal searched desperately for an equalizer . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : portugal 's former galactico figo was shut out but despite dominating territory and possession much of the second half , portugal were unable to find a way through a french defense superbly marshaled by lilian thuram and william gallas . luis figo missed a glorious chance to equalize when he headed over on 78 minutes after a cristiano ronaldo free-kick that french keeper fabien barthez spilled comically . a furious late rally saw portugal camped in french territory but les bleus held firm to keep their dream of a second title alive . the match had threatened to boil over towards the end of the first half when portugal had a penalty appeal of their own waved away . ronaldo - booed whenever he touched the ball in the first half - leapt for a cross and fell over french defender willy sagnol . portugal coach luiz felipe scolari and the entire portugal bench were out of the dug-out in protest but referee larrionda was having none of it , and replays showed there was no contact whatsoever . an entertaining opening 45 minutes saw both sides go close early on ; dispelling fears the match would be a tense affair with five players from each team starting on a yellow card . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : there were few clear chances in the tight game portugal , who had welcomed the return from suspension of midfield enforcer costinha and barcelona playmaker deco , were quickly into their stride with ronaldo looking menacing down the left . both deco and figo forced barthez into scrambled saves in the opening 15 minutes , while midfielder maniche saw a shot fly millimeters over the bar . yet though portugal had the clearer chances , france did not appear to be unduly troubled , their back four restricting their opponents to long-range efforts only . ronaldo , who has been demonized in england this week for his part in the dismissal of wayne rooney last weekend , was singled out as the pantomime villain by french and neutral fans immediately . boos and whistles greeted the manchester united winger 's every touch and he enraged france coach raymond domenech on the half-hour , the french coach accusing him of attempting to con the referee with a dive . dw staff -lrb- nda -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de zinedine zidane : the making of a soccer legend it started in a marseille ghetto before weaving its way through europe , gathering riches on the way .

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de in focus : the road to the final two late extra-time goals kill off germany 's world cup dream three off in pulsating but bad tempered us , italy 1-1 draw italy make light work of ukraine to meet hosts in semi-finals us out of world cup while ghana , italy reach next round match reports -pipe- 05.07.2006 zidane 's penalty decides nervous semi as france make final großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : i 'm not finished just yet : zidane 's penalty ensures the french captain gets a final send-off in comparison to the classic match the night before , france and portugal played out a nervy semi-final in munich with few clear chances .
zinedine zidane 's penalty was enough to put france in sunday 's final against italy . zinedine zidane fired france into their second world cup final appearance in eight years in munich on wednesday , scoring the only goal in a 1-0 semi-final victory over portugal . the french captain shattered portugal 's dreams of a first ever appearance in the final after coolly converting a hotly disputed penalty midway through the first half at the 62,000-seat allianz arena . zidane 's goal was a repeat of his spot-kick winner against the portuguese in the semi-finals of euro 2000 and sent france into a final on sunday against italy - just as it had done six years ago . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : ricardo picked the right side but could n't stop zizou scoring but the decider was shrouded in controversy , with portugal protesting uruguayan referee jorge larrionda 's decision to point to the spot after chelsea defender ricardo carvalho brought down thierry henry just inside the area . a clever touch by henry wrong-footed carvalho who fell but stuck his leg out , and although the arsenal star reacted theatrically to clear contact , larrionda had no hesitation in pointing to the spot . portuguese goalkeeper ricardo had saved three penalties in his side 's shoot-out victory over england in the quarter-finals on saturday but though he dived the right way zidane 's 33rd-minute spot kick gave him no chance , buried majestically into the corner . france , the 1998 champions , spent much of the remainder of the game on the back foot as portugal searched desperately for an equalizer . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : portugal 's former galactico figo was shut out but despite dominating territory and possession much of the second half , portugal were unable to find a way through a french defense superbly marshaled by lilian thuram and william gallas . luis figo missed a glorious chance to equalize when he headed over on 78 minutes after a cristiano ronaldo free-kick that french keeper fabien barthez spilled comically . a furious late rally saw portugal camped in french territory but les bleus held firm to keep their dream of a second title alive . the match had threatened to boil over towards the end of the first half when portugal had a penalty appeal of their own waved away . ronaldo - booed whenever he touched the ball in the first half - leapt for a cross and fell over french defender willy sagnol . portugal coach luiz felipe scolari and the entire portugal bench were out of the dug-out in protest but referee larrionda was having none of it , and replays showed there was no contact whatsoever . an entertaining opening 45 minutes saw both sides go close early on ; dispelling fears the match would be a tense affair with five players from each team starting on a yellow card . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : there were few clear chances in the tight game portugal , who had welcomed the return from suspension of midfield enforcer costinha and barcelona playmaker deco , were quickly into their stride with ronaldo looking menacing down the left . both deco and figo forced barthez into scrambled saves in the opening 15 minutes , while midfielder maniche saw a shot fly millimeters over the bar . yet though portugal had the clearer chances , france did not appear to be unduly troubled , their back four restricting their opponents to long-range efforts only . ronaldo , who has been demonized in england this week for his part in the dismissal of wayne rooney last weekend , was singled out as the pantomime villain by french and neutral fans immediately . boos and whistles greeted the manchester united winger 's every touch and he enraged france coach raymond domenech on the half-hour , the french coach accusing him of attempting to con the referee with a dive . dw staff -lrb- nda -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de zinedine zidane : the making of a soccer legend it started in a marseille ghetto before weaving its way through europe , gathering riches on the way .
the story of zinedine zidane 's soccer journey could become the greatest ever told if it ends with a second world cup .
-lrb- july 5 , 2006 -rrb- magical zizou ready to cast spell over portuguese men of war the masterful zinedine zidane and a resurgent france aim to make it unlucky number 13 for portugal coach luiz felipe scolari in the world cup semi-final in munich on wednesday .
-lrb- july 5 , 2006 -rrb- live ticker : portugal 0:1 france review all the action as it happened on dw-world.de 's live ticker .
www-links dw-world.de : the 2006 world cup news , match reports , previews and features from the 2006 world cup in germany .
9799 picture gallery daily highlights from the world cup the world cup in pictures a nation expects dw-world.de presents germany 's 2006 world cup squad .

zinedine zidane 's penalty was enough to put france in sunday 's final against italy . zinedine zidane fired france into their second world cup final appearance in eight years in munich on wednesday , scoring the only goal in a 1-0 semi-final victory over portugal . the french captain shattered portugal 's dreams of a first ever appearance in the final after coolly converting a hotly disputed penalty midway through the first half at the 62,000-seat allianz arena . zidane 's goal was a repeat of his spot-kick winner against the portuguese in the semi-finals of euro 2000 and sent france into a final on sunday against italy - just as it had done six years ago . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : ricardo picked the right side but could n't stop zizou scoring but the decider was shrouded in controversy , with portugal protesting uruguayan referee jorge larrionda 's decision to point to the spot after chelsea defender ricardo carvalho brought down thierry henry just inside the area . a clever touch by henry wrong-footed carvalho who fell but stuck his leg out , and although the arsenal star reacted theatrically to clear contact , larrionda had no hesitation in pointing to the spot . portuguese goalkeeper ricardo had saved three penalties in his side 's shoot-out victory over england in the quarter-finals on saturday but though he dived the right way zidane 's 33rd-minute spot kick gave him no chance , buried majestically into the corner . france , the 1998 champions , spent much of the remainder of the game on the back foot as portugal searched desperately for an equalizer . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : portugal 's former galactico figo was shut out but despite dominating territory and possession much of the second half , portugal were unable to find a way through a french defense superbly marshaled by lilian thuram and william gallas . luis figo missed a glorious chance to equalize when he headed over on 78 minutes after a cristiano ronaldo free-kick that french keeper fabien barthez spilled comically . a furious late rally saw portugal camped in french territory but les bleus held firm to keep their dream of a second title alive . the match had threatened to boil over towards the end of the first half when portugal had a penalty appeal of their own waved away . ronaldo - booed whenever he touched the ball in the first half - leapt for a cross and fell over french defender willy sagnol . portugal coach luiz felipe scolari and the entire portugal bench were out of the dug-out in protest but referee larrionda was having none of it , and replays showed there was no contact whatsoever . an entertaining opening 45 minutes saw both sides go close early on ; dispelling fears the match would be a tense affair with five players from each team starting on a yellow card . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : there were few clear chances in the tight game portugal , who had welcomed the return from suspension of midfield enforcer costinha and barcelona playmaker deco , were quickly into their stride with ronaldo looking menacing down the left . both deco and figo forced barthez into scrambled saves in the opening 15 minutes , while midfielder maniche saw a shot fly millimeters over the bar . yet though portugal had the clearer chances , france did not appear to be unduly troubled , their back four restricting their opponents to long-range efforts only . ronaldo , who has been demonized in england this week for his part in the dismissal of wayne rooney last weekend , was singled out as the pantomime villain by french and neutral fans immediately . boos and whistles greeted the manchester united winger 's every touch and he enraged france coach raymond domenech on the half-hour , the french coach accusing him of attempting to con the referee with a dive . dw staff -lrb- nda -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de zinedine zidane : the making of a soccer legend it started in a marseille ghetto before weaving its way through europe , gathering riches on the way .

live ticker : portugal 0:1 france -pipe- match reports -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 05.07.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 27.03.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 05.07.2006 live ticker : portugal 0:1 france review all the action as it happened on dw-world.de 's live ticker . clash of the titans soccer legends luis figo and zinedine zidane both want the chance for one more game - and win - after tonight 's match against each other to end their careers on a high note .
the two men , both of whom had actually retired from international soccer once already , have said this world cup will be their final major tournament .
whoever wins in munich will play italy in berlin for soccer 's greatest prize .
tonight 's teams .
portugal -lrb- 4-5-1 -rrb- : 1-ricardo ; 13-miguel , 16-ricardo carvalho , 5-fernando meira , 14-nuno valente ; 6-costinha , 18-maniche , 20-deco , 7-luis figo , 17-cristiano ronaldo ; 9-pauleta coach : luiz felipe scolari france -lrb- 4-2-3-1 -rrb- : 16-fabien barthez ; 19-willy sagnol , 15-lilian thuram , 5-william gallas , 3-eric abidal ; 4-patrick vieira , 6-claude makelele ; 22-franck ribery , 10-zinedine zidane , 7-florent malouda ; 12-thierry henry coach : raymond domenech referee : jorge larrionda -lrb- uruguay -rrb- ten minutes to kick-off in munich .
the stadium is almost full .
lots of portugese blood red and french blue in the stands .
the teams are waiting in the tunnel .
the teams are walking in .
the two captains and real team mates - zidane and figo - look focused and have no time for friendly conversation .
cristiano ronaldo smiles as the portugese anthem begins .
does he know something we do n't ?
the camera sets on zidane for the french anthem .
will it be his last game today , or will he play a second world cup final ?
portugal win the toss .
1. min .
the game is on .
france kick off .
1. min .
malouda gets the first chance as he gets the ball from henry .
his shot is not clean and goes wide .
2. min .
ronaldo comes with good pace along the left wing but is stopped ten meters before the box .
4. min .
good chance for portugal .
ronaldo flies down the wing again and passes into deco outside the box who shoots .
barthez deflects with one hand and pauleta is blocked from hitting the ball into the french goal .
6. min .
the teams are taking turns playing their way to the box .
portugal are a bit faster but the french also combine well .
8. min .
ronaldo has started the game at top speed .
again he approaches the box bit this time flicks the ball backwards to maniche whose shot is only a foot over the bar .
9. min .
in the next attack , figo gets a low cross in that gallas manages to get a foot on .
11. min .
the portugese have had the better chances so far and the french have made unusually many mistakes in the first ten minutes .
13. min .
good combination by the french ends up dangerously close to henry 's foot .
ribery , zidane and abidal play the ball around and the latter gets the cross in that is not more than half a meter away from henry 's foot as he storms towards the far post .
15. min .
figo goes towards the box and is forced to shoot as pauleta is in an off-side position .
the shot is too weak and no problem for barthez .
18. min .
portugal have lost the pressure they had although the french are quite passive at the moment .
20. min .
makelele finds ribery with a lovely pass .
ribery passes to henry at the box line who tries a shot but hits a portugese defender .
23. min .
portugal bite themselves into the french half and ronaldo is the key as they combine but to little result .
25. min .
both teams are all but effective when they reach the box .
most of the time is spent passing within the team at midfield as if they need to build up confidence .
28. min .
henry gets the ball deep in the box to the left and dribbles past his defender to move in .
he flicks the ball towards the center but ricardo is first on the ball .
30. min .
the french defense seem to be warm and it 's getting increasingly more difficult for the portugese to come to any attempts at goal .
31. min .
penalty for france 33. min .
goal france and zidane ! ! 33. min .
henry is the one who wins the penalty as he gets brought down just inside the box but with free range to the goal .
zidane takes two steps back and shows all english players how to beat ricardo .
36. min .
maniche tries a long shot from twenty five meters and barthez does not look the most convincing as he struggles to hold on to the ball .
38. min .
ronaldo moves in from the right and shoots just inside the box .
a good shot that is deflected to a corner .
the young portugese has been the most prolific player on the pitch so far .
41. min .
the french are very disciplined and now control the pace of the game .
43. min .
ronaldo again .
this time he comes down the right and shoots outside the box .
the shot is wide though .
45 + 1. min .
first half is over .
the portugese are pushing on hoping for the equalizer but with no luck .
a quite good first half where the portugese started off at high pace but the french defense soon found their rhythm .
after the french goal the tempo slowed down a bit as les blues took control of the game .
figo is looking a tad concerned as he waits for second half to begin .
45. min .
second half has started .
47. min .
henry gets a great chance !
the french striker gets a ball and starts a solo counter .
he goes past his defender and shoots outside the five meter line .
the ball is deflected to a corner by ricardo .
49. min .
france again !
zidane is having a good time making half the portugese team look like beginners and then passes the ball to ribery whose shot is saved by ricardo .
52. min .
ronaldo runs around with the ball but unlike first half his moves are inefficient .
53. min .
pauleta gets the ball inside the box for the first time .
the portugese striker turns and shoots into the left side of the net .
55. min .
a french counter started by henry sees ribery pass zidane outside the box where the french captain tries to direct the ball on to henry but it 's too hard .
57. min .
miguel is down but the cameras show he stumbles to the ground where he hangs out for a minute or two beefore being brought off the pitch .
he will probably be back soon .
60. min .
miguel is back but it does not look good .
61. min .
abidal gets a hard hit cross straight in the face outside the box .
the french defender is groggy and is helped off .
63. min .
miguel goes off for ferreira .
65. min .
the french are slowly backing home waiting for the counter and focusing on defending their lead .
68. min .
pauleta leaves for simao .
69. min .
malouda goes for wiltord .
70. min .
the portugese have not managed to create a lot so far in second half .
but the french are now deep into their own half and will probably feel some heat before the 90 minutes are over .
72. min .
ribery leaves for govou .
73. min .
the french now have all but henry on their own half .
the striker is hanging out in the mid circle waiting for the long ball .
75. min .
postiga comes on for costinha .
77. min .
portugal 's best chance .
ronaldo hits a free-kick from twentyfive meters that barthez ca n't hold .
the ball goes out to figo who has the whole goal to head the ball into but he is a bit late in his jump and the ball goes over the bar and lands in the net .
79. min .
the french are playing an ever more dangerous game as they do nothing but defend with no intentions to score the winner .
82. min .
carvalho is booked after a bad tackle on wiltord .
83. min .
figo wins a corner for portrugal but it 's poorly taken .
85. min .
henry goes off for saha .
86. min .
saha is booked and will not play in a possible final .
87. min .
the french have been extremely passive the last thirty minutes but there 's no question their tactics are effective .
89. min .
it also seems as if the portugese have half given up .
ronaldo is a shadow of his first half performance and deco has been invisible most of the game .
90 + 2. min .
meira gets the chance to shoot just outside the box but his half volley flies way high .
90 + 3. min .
a corner kick for portugal sees their goalie ricardo in the french box .
the portugese keeper manages a back kick that wins his team another corner .
90 + 4. min .
france are through and will play italy in the 2006 world cup final .
france 's tactics passed the test .
they stood firm at the back and gave the portugese few possibilities to come to a finish .
zidane gets his second final . send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic feedback send us an e-mail .
please include your name and country in your reply .

ronaldo moves in from the right and shoots just inside the box .
a good shot that is deflected to a corner .
the young portugese has been the most prolific player on the pitch so far .
41. min .
the french are very disciplined and now control the pace of the game .
43. min .
ronaldo again .
this time he comes down the right and shoots outside the box .
the shot is wide though .
45 + 1. min .
first half is over .
the portugese are pushing on hoping for the equalizer but with no luck .
a quite good first half where the portugese started off at high pace but the french defense soon found their rhythm .
after the french goal the tempo slowed down a bit as les blues took control of the game .
figo is looking a tad concerned as he waits for second half to begin .
45. min .
second half has started .
47. min .
henry gets a great chance !
the french striker gets a ball and starts a solo counter .
he goes past his defender and shoots outside the five meter line .
the ball is deflected to a corner by ricardo .
49. min .
france again !
zidane is having a good time making half the portugese team look like beginners and then passes the ball to ribery whose shot is saved by ricardo .
52. min .
ronaldo runs around with the ball but unlike first half his moves are inefficient .
53. min .
pauleta gets the ball inside the box for the first time .
the portugese striker turns and shoots into the left side of the net .
55. min .
a french counter started by henry sees ribery pass zidane outside the box where the french captain tries to direct the ball on to henry but it 's too hard .
57. min .
miguel is down but the cameras show he stumbles to the ground where he hangs out for a minute or two beefore being brought off the pitch .
he will probably be back soon .
60. min .
miguel is back but it does not look good .
61. min .
abidal gets a hard hit cross straight in the face outside the box .
the french defender is groggy and is helped off .
63. min .
miguel goes off for ferreira .
65. min .
the french are slowly backing home waiting for the counter and focusing on defending their lead .
68. min .
pauleta leaves for simao .
69. min .
malouda goes for wiltord .
70. min .
the portugese have not managed to create a lot so far in second half .
but the french are now deep into their own half and will probably feel some heat before the 90 minutes are over .
72. min .
ribery leaves for govou .
73. min .
the french now have all but henry on their own half .
the striker is hanging out in the mid circle waiting for the long ball .
75. min .
postiga comes on for costinha .
77. min .
portugal 's best chance .
ronaldo hits a free-kick from twentyfive meters that barthez ca n't hold .
the ball goes out to figo who has the whole goal to head the ball into but he is a bit late in his jump and the ball goes over the bar and lands in the net .
79. min .
the french are playing an ever more dangerous game as they do nothing but defend with no intentions to score the winner .
82. min .
carvalho is booked after a bad tackle on wiltord .
83. min .
figo wins a corner for portrugal but it 's poorly taken .
85. min .
henry goes off for saha .
86. min .
saha is booked and will not play in a possible final .
87. min .
the french have been extremely passive the last thirty minutes but there 's no question their tactics are effective .
89. min .
it also seems as if the portugese have half given up .
ronaldo is a shadow of his first half performance and deco has been invisible most of the game .
90 + 2. min .
meira gets the chance to shoot just outside the box but his half volley flies way high .
90 + 3. min .
a corner kick for portugal sees their goalie ricardo in the french box .
the portugese keeper manages a back kick that wins his team another corner .
90 + 4. min .
france are through and will play italy in the 2006 world cup final .
france 's tactics passed the test .
they stood firm at the back and gave the portugese few possibilities to come to a finish .
zidane gets his second final . send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic feedback send us an e-mail .
please include your name and country in your reply .

klinsmann springs surprises in naming world cup squad germany world cup squad stadiums check out the 12 venues for the 2006 world cup .
world cup 2006 stadiums from the fringe have a laugh read about quirky happenings in thigh-slappin ' germany in this dw-world.de dossier .
visit germany exploring deutschland check out dw-world 's section with tips and reports from all parts of the country . © dw 2010 deutsche welle is not responsible for the content of external websites .

live ticker : portugal 0:1 france -pipe- match reports -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 05.07.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 19.01.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 05.07.2006 live ticker : portugal 0:1 france review all the action as it happened on dw-world.de 's live ticker . clash of the titans soccer legends luis figo and zinedine zidane both want the chance for one more game - and win - after tonight 's match against each other to end their careers on a high note .
the two men , both of whom had actually retired from international soccer once already , have said this world cup will be their final major tournament .
whoever wins in munich will play italy in berlin for soccer 's greatest prize .
tonight 's teams .
portugal -lrb- 4-5-1 -rrb- : 1-ricardo ; 13-miguel , 16-ricardo carvalho , 5-fernando meira , 14-nuno valente ; 6-costinha , 18-maniche , 20-deco , 7-luis figo , 17-cristiano ronaldo ; 9-pauleta coach : luiz felipe scolari france -lrb- 4-2-3-1 -rrb- : 16-fabien barthez ; 19-willy sagnol , 15-lilian thuram , 5-william gallas , 3-eric abidal ; 4-patrick vieira , 6-claude makelele ; 22-franck ribery , 10-zinedine zidane , 7-florent malouda ; 12-thierry henry coach : raymond domenech referee : jorge larrionda -lrb- uruguay -rrb- ten minutes to kick-off in munich .
the stadium is almost full .
lots of portugese blood red and french blue in the stands .
the teams are waiting in the tunnel .
the teams are walking in .
the two captains and real team mates - zidane and figo - look focused and have no time for friendly conversation .
cristiano ronaldo smiles as the portugese anthem begins .
does he know something we do n't ?
the camera sets on zidane for the french anthem .
will it be his last game today , or will he play a second world cup final ?
portugal win the toss .
1. min .
the game is on .
france kick off .
1. min .
malouda gets the first chance as he gets the ball from henry .
his shot is not clean and goes wide .
2. min .
ronaldo comes with good pace along the left wing but is stopped ten meters before the box .
4. min .
good chance for portugal .
ronaldo flies down the wing again and passes into deco outside the box who shoots .
barthez deflects with one hand and pauleta is blocked from hitting the ball into the french goal .
6. min .
the teams are taking turns playing their way to the box .
portugal are a bit faster but the french also combine well .
8. min .
ronaldo has started the game at top speed .
again he approaches the box bit this time flicks the ball backwards to maniche whose shot is only a foot over the bar .
9. min .
in the next attack , figo gets a low cross in that gallas manages to get a foot on .
11. min .
the portugese have had the better chances so far and the french have made unusually many mistakes in the first ten minutes .
13. min .
good combination by the french ends up dangerously close to henry 's foot .
ribery , zidane and abidal play the ball around and the latter gets the cross in that is not more than half a meter away from henry 's foot as he storms towards the far post .
15. min .
figo goes towards the box and is forced to shoot as pauleta is in an off-side position .
the shot is too weak and no problem for barthez .
18. min .
portugal have lost the pressure they had although the french are quite passive at the moment .
20. min .
makelele finds ribery with a lovely pass .
ribery passes to henry at the box line who tries a shot but hits a portugese defender .
23. min .
portugal bite themselves into the french half and ronaldo is the key as they combine but to little result .
25. min .
both teams are all but effective when they reach the box .
most of the time is spent passing within the team at midfield as if they need to build up confidence .
28. min .
henry gets the ball deep in the box to the left and dribbles past his defender to move in .
he flicks the ball towards the center but ricardo is first on the ball .
30. min .
the french defense seem to be warm and it 's getting increasingly more difficult for the portugese to come to any attempts at goal .
31. min .
penalty for france 33. min .
goal france and zidane ! ! 33. min .
henry is the one who wins the penalty as he gets brought down just inside the box but with free range to the goal .
zidane takes two steps back and shows all english players how to beat ricardo .
36. min .
maniche tries a long shot from twenty five meters and barthez does not look the most convincing as he struggles to hold on to the ball .
38. min .
ronaldo moves in from the right and shoots just inside the box .
a good shot that is deflected to a corner .
the young portugese has been the most prolific player on the pitch so far .
41. min .
the french are very disciplined and now control the pace of the game .
43. min .
ronaldo again .
this time he comes down the right and shoots outside the box .
the shot is wide though .
45 + 1. min .
first half is over .
the portugese are pushing on hoping for the equalizer but with no luck .
a quite good first half where the portugese started off at high pace but the french defense soon found their rhythm .
after the french goal the tempo slowed down a bit as les blues took control of the game .
figo is looking a tad concerned as he waits for second half to begin .
45. min .
second half has started .
47. min .
henry gets a great chance !
the french striker gets a ball and starts a solo counter .
he goes past his defender and shoots outside the five meter line .
the ball is deflected to a corner by ricardo .
49. min .
france again !

52. min .

the portugese striker turns and shoots into the left side of the net .

57. min .

he will probably be back soon .
60. min .
miguel is back but it does not look good .
61. min .
abidal gets a hard hit cross straight in the face outside the box .
the french defender is groggy and is helped off .
63. min .
miguel goes off for ferreira .
65. min .
the french are slowly backing home waiting for the counter and focusing on defending their lead .
68. min .
pauleta leaves for simao .
69. min .
malouda goes for wiltord .
70. min .

but the french are now deep into their own half and will probably feel some heat before the 90 minutes are over .
72. min .

postiga comes on for costinha .
