program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de in focus : the road to the final two late extra-time goals kill off germany 's world cup dream three off in pulsating but bad tempered us , italy 1-1 draw italy make light work of ukraine to meet hosts in semi-finals us out of world cup while ghana , italy reach next round match reports -pipe- 05.07.2006 zidane 's penalty decides nervous semi as france make final großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : i 'm not finished just yet : zidane 's penalty ensures the french captain gets a final send-off in comparison to the classic match the night before , france and portugal played out a nervy semi-final in munich with few clear chances .
zinedine zidane 's penalty was enough to put france in sunday 's final against italy . zinedine zidane fired france into their second world cup final appearance in eight years in munich on wednesday , scoring the only goal in a 1-0 semi-final victory over portugal . the french captain shattered portugal 's dreams of a first ever appearance in the final after coolly converting a hotly disputed penalty midway through the first half at the 62,000-seat allianz arena . zidane 's goal was a repeat of his spot-kick winner against the portuguese in the semi-finals of euro 2000 and sent france into a final on sunday against italy - just as it had done six years ago . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : ricardo picked the right side but could n't stop zizou scoring but the decider was shrouded in controversy , with portugal protesting uruguayan referee jorge larrionda 's decision to point to the spot after chelsea defender ricardo carvalho brought down thierry henry just inside the area . a clever touch by henry wrong-footed carvalho who fell but stuck his leg out , and although the arsenal star reacted theatrically to clear contact , larrionda had no hesitation in pointing to the spot . portuguese goalkeeper ricardo had saved three penalties in his side 's shoot-out victory over england in the quarter-finals on saturday but though he dived the right way zidane 's 33rd-minute spot kick gave him no chance , buried majestically into the corner . france , the 1998 champions , spent much of the remainder of the game on the back foot as portugal searched desperately for an equalizer . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : portugal 's former galactico figo was shut out but despite dominating territory and possession much of the second half , portugal were unable to find a way through a french defense superbly marshaled by lilian thuram and william gallas . luis figo missed a glorious chance to equalize when he headed over on 78 minutes after a cristiano ronaldo free-kick that french keeper fabien barthez spilled comically . a furious late rally saw portugal camped in french territory but les bleus held firm to keep their dream of a second title alive . the match had threatened to boil over towards the end of the first half when portugal had a penalty appeal of their own waved away . ronaldo - booed whenever he touched the ball in the first half - leapt for a cross and fell over french defender willy sagnol . portugal coach luiz felipe scolari and the entire portugal bench were out of the dug-out in protest but referee larrionda was having none of it , and replays showed there was no contact whatsoever . an entertaining opening 45 minutes saw both sides go close early on ; dispelling fears the match would be a tense affair with five players from each team starting on a yellow card . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : there were few clear chances in the tight game portugal , who had welcomed the return from suspension of midfield enforcer costinha and barcelona playmaker deco , were quickly into their stride with ronaldo looking menacing down the left . both deco and figo forced barthez into scrambled saves in the opening 15 minutes , while midfielder maniche saw a shot fly millimeters over the bar . yet though portugal had the clearer chances , france did not appear to be unduly troubled , their back four restricting their opponents to long-range efforts only . ronaldo , who has been demonized in england this week for his part in the dismissal of wayne rooney last weekend , was singled out as the pantomime villain by french and neutral fans immediately . boos and whistles greeted the manchester united winger 's every touch and he enraged france coach raymond domenech on the half-hour , the french coach accusing him of attempting to con the referee with a dive . dw staff -lrb- nda -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de zinedine zidane : the making of a soccer legend it started in a marseille ghetto before weaving its way through europe , gathering riches on the way .
the story of zinedine zidane 's soccer journey could become the greatest ever told if it ends with a second world cup .
-lrb- july 5 , 2006 -rrb- magical zizou ready to cast spell over portuguese men of war the masterful zinedine zidane and a resurgent france aim to make it unlucky number 13 for portugal coach luiz felipe scolari in the world cup semi-final in munich on wednesday .
-lrb- july 5 , 2006 -rrb- live ticker : portugal 0:1 france review all the action as it happened on dw-world.de 's live ticker .

eu must stay open , finland says as it takes over reins -pipe- europe -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 05.07.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 25.09.2010 home news germany europe map world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de in focus : the german eu presidency a dummy 's guide to the eu german fm : kosovo biggest problem right now commission proposes eu-wide green card for migrants germany determined to strengthen european police agency europe -pipe- 05.07.2006 eu must stay open , finland says as it takes over reins großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : we are not at a dead end , finland says finland , which took over the reins of the eu july 1 , says the 25-member bloc must keep their doors open to new members . in spite of concerns by eu members over enlargement fatigue , finnish premier matti vanhanen said on wednesday that keeping the bloc open to future members was one priority of his six-month term . " not only is enlargement a key tool for strengthening stability and democracy but it is also one of the strategic responses to the challenges of globalization , " vanhanen told the european parliament .
" the eu must continue to be an open union .
european countries that fulfill the membership criteria must have the possibility to join . " in outlining the priorities , vanhanen departed from finland 's predecessor , austria , who was less than enthusiastic over turkey 's bid for membership .
austria wanted to limit the size of the eu and wanted its ability to absorb new members to become a decisive issue for future candidates . opposition to enlargement is seen as a key factor in the unsuccessful referendums over the draft constitution in france and the netherlands last year . pushi n g o n with the co n stitutio n in addition to consulting with other eu members on the constitution and pushing for its ratification in finland this year , the finnish leader said that it is necessary to move forward with other internal initiatives to reform the eu 's decision-making processes . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : finland 's prime minister , matti vanhanen says that he wants to bring back latin " during our presidency , we will try to look outwards and inwards , " he said .
" i do n't agree with pessimistic speeches about the crisis in the eu .
i believe the current problems can be overcome . "
for example , vanhanen wants more integration in policing and in the judiciary by using a special legal procedure to shift these policies to another level of decision-making , with more powers for the european commission and parliament and less unanimous voting among member states .
" there may be something of a wait-and-see mood in the union , but the world around us is not going to stop and wait , " he said .
" we would be doing future generations of europeans a great disservice if we were simply to shut our eyes to the historic challenges that we face and wait for better times to come . " closer ties with russia other priorities that vanhanen outlined were closer cooperation with russia , pushing through legislative packages such as the chemical law reach and the services directive .
he also pledged more openness in the ministerial meetings as agreed to at the eu summit last june . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : closer ties with the kremlin are a priority one concrete proposal that finland is already pushing is a tax increase on alcohol across the eu .
the topic is already on the agenda for meetings next week . " it is necessary to harmonize the tax rates to even out the price levels of alcohol , " finland said in a press release .
another initiative , considered a bit far out by some , is to publish weekly eu news bulletins in latin on its website every wednesday . the new eu president will also have its hands full with a few tricky issues .
one is a growing dispute between eu member cyprus and candidate turkey .
cyprus wants turkey to open its ports and airspace to their ships and planes . vanhanen said that turkey will be dealt with " openly and honestly " but that is has a " long and bumpy " road ahead in fulfilling membership criteria . no more backslappi n g some eu parliamentarians welcomed the initiatives as a good sign of things to come . " we need the constitution , " martin schulz , a german social democrat , told dpa news service of the push to revive the instrument . on russia , there was more dissent . " we need a stabile partnership with russia , but let 's finish now with the backslapping , " hans-gert pöttering , a german christian democratic eu parliamentarian told dpa , referring to human rights concerns over russia . dw staff -lrb- jb -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de austria hands eu baton to finland on saturday , austria hands over the presidency of the european union to finland .
the alpine republic declared some lofty goals during its time at the top , but to what extent did it deliver ?
-lrb- june 30 , 2006 -rrb- eu leaders postpone constitution decision until 2008 european union leaders on friday left the bloc 's moribund constitution in limbo until 2008 and set tougher terms for the admission of new member states to the 25-nation bloc .
-lrb- june 16 , 2006 -rrb- eu takes stock of cloudy future the eu admitted thursday there would be no " miracles " as it battles to revive its fortunes at a morose summit clouded by institutional limbo and growing doubts over enlargement plans .
-lrb- june 16 , 2006 -rrb- audios and videos on the topic finland sets a real example for other european countries as one of the most prosperous and competitive countries in europe .
and they lead most significantly in providing an effective education system and care for their children .
finland has just taken over the eu presidency and they have a lot on their plate in this crisis-filled time .
but they believe they can successfully tackle issues and move the eu forward .
feedback what do you think of the finnish plans ?
please include your name and country in your reply .

press review : chin up , germany -pipe- europe -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 05.07.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 01.04.2011 home news germany europe map world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de europe -pipe- 05.07.2006 press review : chin up , germany großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : a sad walk home for this germany fan european editorials on wednesday commented on germany 's dramatic loss to italy in tuesday 's world cup semi-final match , with most papers giving germany a sympathetic pat on the back for a job well done . in a display of good sportsmanship , berlin 's morge n post allowed readers a moment of sadness , but only a moment .
" the close defeat does n't hurt , " the paper said , " because the german team achieved so much . "
" these players did n't just come out ahead of strong nations such as brazil , argentina , and the netherlands - their appearances were also really enjoyable .
they also changed the people in this country , at least for three and a half weeks , leaving them happier , more relaxed and more confident . " " we 're crying with you , " read the headline in the popular tabloid bild zeitu n g , " but you 're still heroes ! "
the paper was full of encouragement after the bitter defeat , and full of confidence that germany " will take third place on saturday , and not complain ... to klinsi and all the boys , we say , thank you for this wonderful world cup .
what has grown in the last couple of weeks will remain .
the germans have re-discovered a love for their country and their team , " bild wrote . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : germany 's coach jürgen klinsmann : what does his future hold ?
the fra n kfurter allgemei n e zeitu n g commented on the achievements of german coach jürgen klinsmann , writing that the passionate soccer that brought germany so much joy is a victory that no one can take away .
the california-based national trainer must now decide whether he will continue in his role , the paper said .
" thanks to klinsmann , german soccer gained an unexpected easiness and a new perspective .
not to use this , to let the flame die , would be a much greater loss than the defeat in the semi-final match - with or without klinsmann . " outside germany , britain 's daily mirror commented on the italian team , saying that tuesday 's victory would go a long way in redeeming italy in the wake of the soccer corruption scandal that " infected the soul of the nation ... they came as the pariahs of the world , the men who represented everything that football wants to forget about the dark side of the beautiful game , " the paper wrote .
" but on sunday , it is italy who will march into berlin 's olympic stadium , their chests puffed out with pride , their honor restored , their courage rewarded . " the guardia n of london commented that germany has been " brusquely shaken awake from its world cup dream , " but said that the team can hold their heads high .
" throughout the world cup they played intelligent , aggressive football , " the paper said , adding that tuesday 's game could have gone either way .
" afterwards there were tears in the westfalenstadion and across the country , but better this death than meek surrender . " sweden 's afto n bladet was pleased with the match , praising both sides .
" italy came to the world cup as the object of hatred and has now achieved more than anyone could have dreamed , " the paper wrote .
" the italians played for their honor , the germans for a nation in ecstasy .
finally , a world cup match that met the greatest of expectations . " and as to be expected , italy 's press was full of praise for the men in blue .
" wonderful italy , " wrote rome 's la stampa .
" grosso and del piero have given us the finals , we 're going to berlin .
a party has exploded on our streets - we 're all united through the blue triumph . " dw staff -lrb- dc -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de two late extra-time goals kill off germany 's world cup dream italy scored two sensational late goals in extra-time to book their place in the world cup final for the first time in 12 years with their 2-0 win crushing the dreams of host nation germany in dortmund on tuesday .
-lrb- july 4 , 2006 -rrb- the world cup is over for germany but the party must continue hosts germany are out of the world cup after losing to italy .
the whole country goes into mourning but dw-world.de believes germany still has plenty to celebrate even though the dream is now over . -lrb- july 4 , 2006 -rrb- " you are heroes , " shocked and disappointed germans say after losing the world cup semi-finals to italy tuesday , the host nation reflects on what might have been but say that they are proud of their team 's accomplishments .
-lrb- july 5 , 2006 -rrb- feedback what 's your reaction to germany 's loss against italy ?
send us an e-mail .
please include your name and country in your reply .

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de europe -pipe- 05.07.2006 press review : chin up , germany großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : a sad walk home for this germany fan european editorials on wednesday commented on germany 's dramatic loss to italy in tuesday 's world cup semi-final match , with most papers giving germany a sympathetic pat on the back for a job well done . in a display of good sportsmanship , berlin 's morge n post allowed readers a moment of sadness , but only a moment .
" the close defeat does n't hurt , " the paper said , " because the german team achieved so much . "
" these players did n't just come out ahead of strong nations such as brazil , argentina , and the netherlands - their appearances were also really enjoyable .
they also changed the people in this country , at least for three and a half weeks , leaving them happier , more relaxed and more confident . " " we 're crying with you , " read the headline in the popular tabloid bild zeitu n g , " but you 're still heroes ! "
the paper was full of encouragement after the bitter defeat , and full of confidence that germany " will take third place on saturday , and not complain ... to klinsi and all the boys , we say , thank you for this wonderful world cup .
what has grown in the last couple of weeks will remain .
the germans have re-discovered a love for their country and their team , " bild wrote . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : germany 's coach jürgen klinsmann : what does his future hold ?
the fra n kfurter allgemei n e zeitu n g commented on the achievements of german coach jürgen klinsmann , writing that the passionate soccer that brought germany so much joy is a victory that no one can take away .
the california-based national trainer must now decide whether he will continue in his role , the paper said .
" thanks to klinsmann , german soccer gained an unexpected easiness and a new perspective .
not to use this , to let the flame die , would be a much greater loss than the defeat in the semi-final match - with or without klinsmann . " outside germany , britain 's daily mirror commented on the italian team , saying that tuesday 's victory would go a long way in redeeming italy in the wake of the soccer corruption scandal that " infected the soul of the nation ... they came as the pariahs of the world , the men who represented everything that football wants to forget about the dark side of the beautiful game , " the paper wrote .
" but on sunday , it is italy who will march into berlin 's olympic stadium , their chests puffed out with pride , their honor restored , their courage rewarded . " the guardia n of london commented that germany has been " brusquely shaken awake from its world cup dream , " but said that the team can hold their heads high .
" throughout the world cup they played intelligent , aggressive football , " the paper said , adding that tuesday 's game could have gone either way .
" afterwards there were tears in the westfalenstadion and across the country , but better this death than meek surrender . " sweden 's afto n bladet was pleased with the match , praising both sides .
" italy came to the world cup as the object of hatred and has now achieved more than anyone could have dreamed , " the paper wrote .
" the italians played for their honor , the germans for a nation in ecstasy .
finally , a world cup match that met the greatest of expectations . " and as to be expected , italy 's press was full of praise for the men in blue .
" wonderful italy , " wrote rome 's la stampa .
" grosso and del piero have given us the finals , we 're going to berlin .
a party has exploded on our streets - we 're all united through the blue triumph . " dw staff -lrb- dc -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de two late extra-time goals kill off germany 's world cup dream italy scored two sensational late goals in extra-time to book their place in the world cup final for the first time in 12 years with their 2-0 win crushing the dreams of host nation germany in dortmund on tuesday .
-lrb- july 4 , 2006 -rrb- the world cup is over for germany but the party must continue hosts germany are out of the world cup after losing to italy .

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de europe -pipe- 05.07.2006 press review : chin up , germany großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : a sad walk home for this germany fan european editorials on wednesday commented on germany 's dramatic loss to italy in tuesday 's world cup semi-final match , with most papers giving germany a sympathetic pat on the back for a job well done . in a display of good sportsmanship , berlin 's morge n post allowed readers a moment of sadness , but only a moment .
" the close defeat does n't hurt , " the paper said , " because the german team achieved so much . "
" these players did n't just come out ahead of strong nations such as brazil , argentina , and the netherlands - their appearances were also really enjoyable .
they also changed the people in this country , at least for three and a half weeks , leaving them happier , more relaxed and more confident . " " we 're crying with you , " read the headline in the popular tabloid bild zeitu n g , " but you 're still heroes ! "
the paper was full of encouragement after the bitter defeat , and full of confidence that germany " will take third place on saturday , and not complain ... to klinsi and all the boys , we say , thank you for this wonderful world cup .
what has grown in the last couple of weeks will remain .
the germans have re-discovered a love for their country and their team , " bild wrote . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : germany 's coach jürgen klinsmann : what does his future hold ?
the fra n kfurter allgemei n e zeitu n g commented on the achievements of german coach jürgen klinsmann , writing that the passionate soccer that brought germany so much joy is a victory that no one can take away .
the california-based national trainer must now decide whether he will continue in his role , the paper said .
" thanks to klinsmann , german soccer gained an unexpected easiness and a new perspective .
not to use this , to let the flame die , would be a much greater loss than the defeat in the semi-final match - with or without klinsmann . " outside germany , britain 's daily mirror commented on the italian team , saying that tuesday 's victory would go a long way in redeeming italy in the wake of the soccer corruption scandal that " infected the soul of the nation ... they came as the pariahs of the world , the men who represented everything that football wants to forget about the dark side of the beautiful game , " the paper wrote .
" but on sunday , it is italy who will march into berlin 's olympic stadium , their chests puffed out with pride , their honor restored , their courage rewarded . " the guardia n of london commented that germany has been " brusquely shaken awake from its world cup dream , " but said that the team can hold their heads high .
" throughout the world cup they played intelligent , aggressive football , " the paper said , adding that tuesday 's game could have gone either way .
" afterwards there were tears in the westfalenstadion and across the country , but better this death than meek surrender . " sweden 's afto n bladet was pleased with the match , praising both sides .
" italy came to the world cup as the object of hatred and has now achieved more than anyone could have dreamed , " the paper wrote .
" the italians played for their honor , the germans for a nation in ecstasy .
finally , a world cup match that met the greatest of expectations . " and as to be expected , italy 's press was full of praise for the men in blue .
" wonderful italy , " wrote rome 's la stampa .
" grosso and del piero have given us the finals , we 're going to berlin .
a party has exploded on our streets - we 're all united through the blue triumph . " dw staff -lrb- dc -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de two late extra-time goals kill off germany 's world cup dream italy scored two sensational late goals in extra-time to book their place in the world cup final for the first time in 12 years with their 2-0 win crushing the dreams of host nation germany in dortmund on tuesday .
-lrb- july 4 , 2006 -rrb- the world cup is over for germany but the party must continue hosts germany are out of the world cup after losing to italy .
the whole country goes into mourning but dw-world.de believes germany still has plenty to celebrate even though the dream is now over . -lrb- july 4 , 2006 -rrb- " you are heroes , " shocked and disappointed germans say after losing the world cup semi-finals to italy tuesday , the host nation reflects on what might have been but say that they are proud of their team 's accomplishments .

" these players did n't just come out ahead of strong nations such as brazil , argentina , and the netherlands - their appearances were also really enjoyable .
they also changed the people in this country , at least for three and a half weeks , leaving them happier , more relaxed and more confident . " " we 're crying with you , " read the headline in the popular tabloid bild zeitu n g , " but you 're still heroes ! "

" the guardia n of london commented that germany has been " brusquely shaken awake from its world cup dream , " but said that the team can hold their heads high .
" throughout the world cup they played intelligent , aggressive football , " the paper said , adding that tuesday 's game could have gone either way .
" afterwards there were tears in the westfalenstadion and across the country , but better this death than meek surrender . " sweden 's afto n bladet was pleased with the match , praising both sides .
" italy came to the world cup as the object of hatred and has now achieved more than anyone could have dreamed , " the paper wrote .
" the italians played for their honor , the germans for a nation in ecstasy .
finally , a world cup match that met the greatest of expectations . " and as to be expected , italy 's press was full of praise for the men in blue .
" wonderful italy , " wrote rome 's la stampa .
" grosso and del piero have given us the finals , we 're going to berlin .
a party has exploded on our streets - we 're all united through the blue triumph . " you are heroes , " shocked and disappointed germans say -pipe- germany -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 05.07.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 04.07.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio about dw-radio what 's on ?
reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de germany -pipe- 05.07.2006 " you are heroes , " shocked and disappointed germans say großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : there were few happy faces on the fan mile tuesday after losing the world cup semi-finals to italy tuesday , the host nation reflects on what might have been but say that they are proud of their team 's accomplishments . for months , germans prepared for defeat at the world cup .
media commentators criticized coach jurgen klinsmann as the team suffered a series of pre-match defeats . but that was before a string of wins in the world cup matches threw the normally cautious and skeptical german nature out the door . so it was that much more bitter when on tuesday , italy beat germany 2-0 in last minute goals . " it is very sad to end like this , because we really thought germany could do it now , " matthias brucker , standing in dortmund 's friedenplatz , told the bbc . others hailed the team 's surprisingly long run . " it 's a pity - it was a great game , " said chancellor angela merkel , who sat next to italian prime minister romano prodi during the game .
" unfortunately it was n't quite enough .
but this team can still accomplish a lot . " the top-selling bild newspaper also tried for a glass-half-full view with the banner headline , " we are crying with you !
you are still heroes " around a giant photo of klinsmann , head in hands . shock , surprise millions of fans around germany watched the match with baited breath .
in dortmund , 200,000 fans cheered and groaned during the game at the stadium ; outside , around the country , fans crowded around big screens to follow the game . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : they expected their team to do better in berlin , almost a million people trudged away from the fan mile behind the capital 's best-known monument , the brandenburg gate , after following the action on big screens .
the fan mile has been one of the abiding successes of this world cup , and had to be extended ahead of the match . during the final minutes of the game , the area was eerily quiet .
after the winning goals , some cried , others applauded , most waved flags . " we are still proud of them , " lukas schmidt , 18 , told dpa .
" at the start no-one said they had a chance .
but they went all the way to the last minute of the semi-finals .
you ca n't ask for more . " klinsmann echoed the sentiment . " we are hugely disappointed , " he told dpa .
" it 's amazing the spirit -lrb- the team -rrb- showed , the character .
they made a whole country really proud . " a celebratio n it was a different mood among italians - pure elation . " after the final whistle , the italians were the only ones cheering , " wrote berlin 's der tagesspiegel . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : italy supporters are thrilled " we were the better team in the game and finally we won - so we spoil the party of the germans , " daniel cacchio , an italian who lives in essen , told the bbc . many supporters expressed surprise . ludovico megalini told the bbc that it was " wonderful ... an incredible emotion for me .
i ca n't believe it now - maybe tomorrow when i wake up .
i can think only of sunday now . " " the germans can go home but we 're going to party - we 're going to drink their beer and eat their sausages , " he added .
" it 's great to celebrate in germany after beating germany . " italy 's sports dailies , delighted to take a step back from the mood of gloom that surrounds the club game at home which is mired in a wide-ranging match fixing scandal in which four clubs are accused of bribing referees were in festive mood . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : keep the good feeling anyway , beckenbauer says " we love you , " gushed the corriere dello sport in a large-type headline , while gazetta dello sport celebrated with " fly high italy , fly high .
we are great and we know it .
we have beaten the germans , they will boycott our pizzas , but we have the taste and flavour of victory . " keep the feeli n g while football legend franz beckenbauer said he hoped that germans would stay in an upbeat mood regardless , president horst köhler added that he hoped that germans would sustain the new-found patriotism they discovered during the tournament , when for the first time since the war waving german flags and singing the national anthem were accepted as natural gestures of healthy national pride . " we are on the right track toward standing up for ourselves and taking pride in what we have achieved since 1945 , " he told bild .
" the germans identify with this country and its national colors .
i think that is terrific . " he added that the country could still seek strength in the unexpected winning streak that took it to the semi-finals . " we can achieve a lot if we have the courage to dare to do something new , " he said .
" we should remember that after the world cup . " dw staff -lrb- jb -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de the world cup is over for germany but the party must continue hosts germany are out of the world cup after losing to italy .
the whole country goes into mourning but dw-world.de believes germany still has plenty to celebrate even though the dream is now over .
-lrb- july 4 , 2006 -rrb- the world cup as a platform for a good cause fifa has taken a taken up a social cause - condemning racism - as a prelude to the matches .
the use of star striker miroslav klose also brings attention to the campaign against landmines .
-lrb- july 4 , 2006 -rrb- south african president in germany to take world cup reins south african president thabo mbeki will visit germany this week for the official handover of the football world cup to be hosted by south africa in 2010 , a senior official said tuesday .
-lrb- july 4 , 2006 -rrb- 9800 radio news listen to world headlines from the top of the hour .
dw-tv europe live journal - news with reporters we 're sorry , due to legal issues this content can not be transmitted as live stream .
if you are inside the united states , it is still possible for you to enjoy dw-tv .
for more information , please click here .
dw-radio live concert hour schwetzingen festival -lrb- 2 -rrb- listen live media center watch and listen explore new content daily in dw 's multimedia archive .
art german photographer lala aufsberg 's work is a fascinating historical record of the 20th century .
watch the video feature life behind the wall dw-tv presents a unique animated depiction of the former german-german border .

" you are heroes , " shocked and disappointed germans say -pipe- germany -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 05.07.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 25.01.2011 home news germany german reunification europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de germany -pipe- 05.07.2006 " you are heroes , " shocked and disappointed germans say großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : there were few happy faces on the fan mile tuesday after losing the world cup semi-finals to italy tuesday , the host nation reflects on what might have been but say that they are proud of their team 's accomplishments . for months , germans prepared for defeat at the world cup .
media commentators criticized coach jurgen klinsmann as the team suffered a series of pre-match defeats . but that was before a string of wins in the world cup matches threw the normally cautious and skeptical german nature out the door . so it was that much more bitter when on tuesday , italy beat germany 2-0 in last minute goals . " it is very sad to end like this , because we really thought germany could do it now , " matthias brucker , standing in dortmund 's friedenplatz , told the bbc . others hailed the team 's surprisingly long run . " it 's a pity - it was a great game , " said chancellor angela merkel , who sat next to italian prime minister romano prodi during the game .
" unfortunately it was n't quite enough .
but this team can still accomplish a lot . " the top-selling bild newspaper also tried for a glass-half-full view with the banner headline , " we are crying with you !
you are still heroes " around a giant photo of klinsmann , head in hands . shock , surprise millions of fans around germany watched the match with baited breath .
in dortmund , 200,000 fans cheered and groaned during the game at the stadium ; outside , around the country , fans crowded around big screens to follow the game . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : they expected their team to do better in berlin , almost a million people trudged away from the fan mile behind the capital 's best-known monument , the brandenburg gate , after following the action on big screens .
the fan mile has been one of the abiding successes of this world cup , and had to be extended ahead of the match . during the final minutes of the game , the area was eerily quiet .
after the winning goals , some cried , others applauded , most waved flags . " we are still proud of them , " lukas schmidt , 18 , told dpa .
" at the start no-one said they had a chance .
but they went all the way to the last minute of the semi-finals .
you ca n't ask for more . " klinsmann echoed the sentiment . " we are hugely disappointed , " he told dpa .
" it 's amazing the spirit -lrb- the team -rrb- showed , the character .
they made a whole country really proud . " a celebratio n it was a different mood among italians - pure elation . " after the final whistle , the italians were the only ones cheering , " wrote berlin 's der tagesspiegel . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : italy supporters are thrilled " we were the better team in the game and finally we won - so we spoil the party of the germans , " daniel cacchio , an italian who lives in essen , told the bbc . many supporters expressed surprise . ludovico megalini told the bbc that it was " wonderful ... an incredible emotion for me .
i ca n't believe it now - maybe tomorrow when i wake up .
i can think only of sunday now . " " the germans can go home but we 're going to party - we 're going to drink their beer and eat their sausages , " he added .
" it 's great to celebrate in germany after beating germany . " italy 's sports dailies , delighted to take a step back from the mood of gloom that surrounds the club game at home which is mired in a wide-ranging match fixing scandal in which four clubs are accused of bribing referees were in festive mood . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : keep the good feeling anyway , beckenbauer says " we love you , " gushed the corriere dello sport in a large-type headline , while gazetta dello sport celebrated with " fly high italy , fly high .
we are great and we know it .
we have beaten the germans , they will boycott our pizzas , but we have the taste and flavour of victory . " keep the feeli n g while football legend franz beckenbauer said he hoped that germans would stay in an upbeat mood regardless , president horst köhler added that he hoped that germans would sustain the new-found patriotism they discovered during the tournament , when for the first time since the war waving german flags and singing the national anthem were accepted as natural gestures of healthy national pride . " we are on the right track toward standing up for ourselves and taking pride in what we have achieved since 1945 , " he told bild .
" the germans identify with this country and its national colors .
i think that is terrific . " he added that the country could still seek strength in the unexpected winning streak that took it to the semi-finals . " we can achieve a lot if we have the courage to dare to do something new , " he said .
" we should remember that after the world cup . " dw staff -lrb- jb -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de the world cup is over for germany but the party must continue hosts germany are out of the world cup after losing to italy .
the whole country goes into mourning but dw-world.de believes germany still has plenty to celebrate even though the dream is now over .
-lrb- july 4 , 2006 -rrb- the world cup as a platform for a good cause fifa has taken a taken up a social cause - condemning racism - as a prelude to the matches .
the use of star striker miroslav klose also brings attention to the campaign against landmines .
-lrb- july 4 , 2006 -rrb- south african president in germany to take world cup reins south african president thabo mbeki will visit germany this week for the official handover of the football world cup to be hosted by south africa in 2010 , a senior official said tuesday .
-lrb- july 4 , 2006 -rrb- feedback send us an e-mail .
please include your name and country in your reply .

they made a whole country really proud . " a celebratio n it was a different mood among italians - pure elation . " after the final whistle , the italians were the only ones cheering , " wrote berlin 's der tagesspiegel . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : italy supporters are thrilled " we were the better team in the game and finally we won - so we spoil the party of the germans , " daniel cacchio , an italian who lives in essen , told the bbc . many supporters expressed surprise . ludovico megalini told the bbc that it was " wonderful ... an incredible emotion for me .
i ca n't believe it now - maybe tomorrow when i wake up .
i can think only of sunday now . " " the germans can go home but we 're going to party - we 're going to drink their beer and eat their sausages , " he added .
" it 's great to celebrate in germany after beating germany . " italy 's sports dailies , delighted to take a step back from the mood of gloom that surrounds the club game at home which is mired in a wide-ranging match fixing scandal in which four clubs are accused of bribing referees were in festive mood . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : keep the good feeling anyway , beckenbauer says " we love you , " gushed the corriere dello sport in a large-type headline , while gazetta dello sport celebrated with " fly high italy , fly high .
we are great and we know it .
we have beaten the germans , they will boycott our pizzas , but we have the taste and flavour of victory . " keep the feeli n g while football legend franz beckenbauer said he hoped that germans would stay in an upbeat mood regardless , president horst köhler added that he hoped that germans would sustain the new-found patriotism they discovered during the tournament , when for the first time since the war waving german flags and singing the national anthem were accepted as natural gestures of healthy national pride . " we are on the right track toward standing up for ourselves and taking pride in what we have achieved since 1945 , " he told bild .
" the germans identify with this country and its national colors .
i think that is terrific . " he added that the country could still seek strength in the unexpected winning streak that took it to the semi-finals . " we can achieve a lot if we have the courage to dare to do something new , " he said .
" we should remember that after the world cup . " dw staff -lrb- jb -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de the world cup is over for germany but the party must continue hosts germany are out of the world cup after losing to italy .

i can think only of sunday now . " " the germans can go home but we 're going to party - we 're going to drink their beer and eat their sausages , " he added .
" it 's great to celebrate in germany after beating germany . " italy 's sports dailies , delighted to take a step back from the mood of gloom that surrounds the club game at home which is mired in a wide-ranging match fixing scandal in which four clubs are accused of bribing referees were in festive mood . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : keep the good feeling anyway , beckenbauer says " we love you , " gushed the corriere dello sport in a large-type headline , while gazetta dello sport celebrated with " fly high italy , fly high .
we are great and we know it .
we have beaten the germans , they will boycott our pizzas , but we have the taste and flavour of victory . " keep the feeli n g while football legend franz beckenbauer said he hoped that germans would stay in an upbeat mood regardless , president horst köhler added that he hoped that germans would sustain the new-found patriotism they discovered during the tournament , when for the first time since the war waving german flags and singing the national anthem were accepted as natural gestures of healthy national pride . " we are on the right track toward standing up for ourselves and taking pride in what we have achieved since 1945 , " he told bild .
" the germans identify with this country and its national colors .
i think that is terrific . " he added that the country could still seek strength in the unexpected winning streak that took it to the semi-finals . " we can achieve a lot if we have the courage to dare to do something new , " he said .
" we should remember that after the world cup . " dw staff -lrb- jb -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de the world cup is over for germany but the party must continue hosts germany are out of the world cup after losing to italy .
the whole country goes into mourning but dw-world.de believes germany still has plenty to celebrate even though the dream is now over .
-lrb- july 4 , 2006 -rrb- the world cup as a platform for a good cause fifa has taken a taken up a social cause - condemning racism - as a prelude to the matches .
the use of star striker miroslav klose also brings attention to the campaign against landmines .
-lrb- july 4 , 2006 -rrb- south african president in germany to take world cup reins south african president thabo mbeki will visit germany this week for the official handover of the football world cup to be hosted by south africa in 2010 , a senior official said tuesday .

please include your name and country in your reply .

" you are heroes , " shocked and disappointed germans say -pipe- germany -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 05.07.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 31.10.2010 home news germany german reunification europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de germany -pipe- 05.07.2006 " you are heroes , " shocked and disappointed germans say großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : there were few happy faces on the fan mile tuesday after losing the world cup semi-finals to italy tuesday , the host nation reflects on what might have been but say that they are proud of their team 's accomplishments . for months , germans prepared for defeat at the world cup .
media commentators criticized coach jurgen klinsmann as the team suffered a series of pre-match defeats . but that was before a string of wins in the world cup matches threw the normally cautious and skeptical german nature out the door . so it was that much more bitter when on tuesday , italy beat germany 2-0 in last minute goals . " it is very sad to end like this , because we really thought germany could do it now , " matthias brucker , standing in dortmund 's friedenplatz , told the bbc . others hailed the team 's surprisingly long run . " it 's a pity - it was a great game , " said chancellor angela merkel , who sat next to italian prime minister romano prodi during the game .
" unfortunately it was n't quite enough .
but this team can still accomplish a lot . " the top-selling bild newspaper also tried for a glass-half-full view with the banner headline , " we are crying with you !
you are still heroes " around a giant photo of klinsmann , head in hands . shock , surprise millions of fans around germany watched the match with baited breath .
in dortmund , 200,000 fans cheered and groaned during the game at the stadium ; outside , around the country , fans crowded around big screens to follow the game . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : they expected their team to do better in berlin , almost a million people trudged away from the fan mile behind the capital 's best-known monument , the brandenburg gate , after following the action on big screens .
the fan mile has been one of the abiding successes of this world cup , and had to be extended ahead of the match . during the final minutes of the game , the area was eerily quiet .
after the winning goals , some cried , others applauded , most waved flags . " we are still proud of them , " lukas schmidt , 18 , told dpa .
" at the start no-one said they had a chance .
but they went all the way to the last minute of the semi-finals .
you ca n't ask for more . " klinsmann echoed the sentiment . " we are hugely disappointed , " he told dpa .
" it 's amazing the spirit -lrb- the team -rrb- showed , the character .
they made a whole country really proud . " a celebratio n it was a different mood among italians - pure elation . " after the final whistle , the italians were the only ones cheering , " wrote berlin 's der tagesspiegel . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : italy supporters are thrilled " we were the better team in the game and finally we won - so we spoil the party of the germans , " daniel cacchio , an italian who lives in essen , told the bbc . many supporters expressed surprise . ludovico megalini told the bbc that it was " wonderful ... an incredible emotion for me .
i ca n't believe it now - maybe tomorrow when i wake up .
i can think only of sunday now . " " the germans can go home but we 're going to party - we 're going to drink their beer and eat their sausages , " he added .
" it 's great to celebrate in germany after beating germany . " italy 's sports dailies , delighted to take a step back from the mood of gloom that surrounds the club game at home which is mired in a wide-ranging match fixing scandal in which four clubs are accused of bribing referees were in festive mood . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : keep the good feeling anyway , beckenbauer says " we love you , " gushed the corriere dello sport in a large-type headline , while gazetta dello sport celebrated with " fly high italy , fly high .
we are great and we know it .
we have beaten the germans , they will boycott our pizzas , but we have the taste and flavour of victory . " keep the feeli n g while football legend franz beckenbauer said he hoped that germans would stay in an upbeat mood regardless , president horst köhler added that he hoped that germans would sustain the new-found patriotism they discovered during the tournament , when for the first time since the war waving german flags and singing the national anthem were accepted as natural gestures of healthy national pride . " we are on the right track toward standing up for ourselves and taking pride in what we have achieved since 1945 , " he told bild .
" the germans identify with this country and its national colors .
i think that is terrific . " he added that the country could still seek strength in the unexpected winning streak that took it to the semi-finals . " we can achieve a lot if we have the courage to dare to do something new , " he said .
" we should remember that after the world cup . " dw staff -lrb- jb -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de the world cup is over for germany but the party must continue hosts germany are out of the world cup after losing to italy .
the whole country goes into mourning but dw-world.de believes germany still has plenty to celebrate even though the dream is now over .
-lrb- july 4 , 2006 -rrb- the world cup as a platform for a good cause fifa has taken a taken up a social cause - condemning racism - as a prelude to the matches .
the use of star striker miroslav klose also brings attention to the campaign against landmines .
-lrb- july 4 , 2006 -rrb- south african president in germany to take world cup reins south african president thabo mbeki will visit germany this week for the official handover of the football world cup to be hosted by south africa in 2010 , a senior official said tuesday .
-lrb- july 4 , 2006 -rrb- feedback send us an e-mail .
please include your name and country in your reply .

live ticker : portugal 0:1 france -pipe- match reports -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 05.07.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 06.05.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio about dw-radio what 's on ?
reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 05.07.2006 live ticker : portugal 0:1 france review all the action as it happened on dw-world.de 's live ticker . clash of the titans soccer legends luis figo and zinedine zidane both want the chance for one more game - and win - after tonight 's match against each other to end their careers on a high note .
the two men , both of whom had actually retired from international soccer once already , have said this world cup will be their final major tournament .
whoever wins in munich will play italy in berlin for soccer 's greatest prize .
tonight 's teams .
portugal -lrb- 4-5-1 -rrb- : 1-ricardo ; 13-miguel , 16-ricardo carvalho , 5-fernando meira , 14-nuno valente ; 6-costinha , 18-maniche , 20-deco , 7-luis figo , 17-cristiano ronaldo ; 9-pauleta coach : luiz felipe scolari france -lrb- 4-2-3-1 -rrb- : 16-fabien barthez ; 19-willy sagnol , 15-lilian thuram , 5-william gallas , 3-eric abidal ; 4-patrick vieira , 6-claude makelele ; 22-franck ribery , 10-zinedine zidane , 7-florent malouda ; 12-thierry henry coach : raymond domenech referee : jorge larrionda -lrb- uruguay -rrb- ten minutes to kick-off in munich .
the stadium is almost full .
lots of portugese blood red and french blue in the stands .
the teams are waiting in the tunnel .
the teams are walking in .
the two captains and real team mates - zidane and figo - look focused and have no time for friendly conversation .
cristiano ronaldo smiles as the portugese anthem begins .
does he know something we do n't ?
the camera sets on zidane for the french anthem .
will it be his last game today , or will he play a second world cup final ?
portugal win the toss .
1. min .
the game is on .
france kick off .
1. min .
malouda gets the first chance as he gets the ball from henry .
his shot is not clean and goes wide .
2. min .
ronaldo comes with good pace along the left wing but is stopped ten meters before the box .
4. min .
good chance for portugal .
ronaldo flies down the wing again and passes into deco outside the box who shoots .
barthez deflects with one hand and pauleta is blocked from hitting the ball into the french goal .
6. min .
the teams are taking turns playing their way to the box .
portugal are a bit faster but the french also combine well .
8. min .
ronaldo has started the game at top speed .
again he approaches the box bit this time flicks the ball backwards to maniche whose shot is only a foot over the bar .
9. min .
in the next attack , figo gets a low cross in that gallas manages to get a foot on .
11. min .
the portugese have had the better chances so far and the french have made unusually many mistakes in the first ten minutes .
13. min .
good combination by the french ends up dangerously close to henry 's foot .
ribery , zidane and abidal play the ball around and the latter gets the cross in that is not more than half a meter away from henry 's foot as he storms towards the far post .
15. min .
figo goes towards the box and is forced to shoot as pauleta is in an off-side position .
the shot is too weak and no problem for barthez .
18. min .
portugal have lost the pressure they had although the french are quite passive at the moment .
20. min .
makelele finds ribery with a lovely pass .
ribery passes to henry at the box line who tries a shot but hits a portugese defender .
23. min .
portugal bite themselves into the french half and ronaldo is the key as they combine but to little result .
25. min .
both teams are all but effective when they reach the box .
most of the time is spent passing within the team at midfield as if they need to build up confidence .
28. min .
henry gets the ball deep in the box to the left and dribbles past his defender to move in .
he flicks the ball towards the center but ricardo is first on the ball .
30. min .
the french defense seem to be warm and it 's getting increasingly more difficult for the portugese to come to any attempts at goal .
31. min .
penalty for france 33. min .
goal france and zidane ! ! 33. min .
henry is the one who wins the penalty as he gets brought down just inside the box but with free range to the goal .
zidane takes two steps back and shows all english players how to beat ricardo .
36. min .
maniche tries a long shot from twenty five meters and barthez does not look the most convincing as he struggles to hold on to the ball .
38. min .
ronaldo moves in from the right and shoots just inside the box .
a good shot that is deflected to a corner .
the young portugese has been the most prolific player on the pitch so far .
41. min .
the french are very disciplined and now control the pace of the game .
43. min .
ronaldo again .
this time he comes down the right and shoots outside the box .
the shot is wide though .
45 + 1. min .
first half is over .
the portugese are pushing on hoping for the equalizer but with no luck .
a quite good first half where the portugese started off at high pace but the french defense soon found their rhythm .
after the french goal the tempo slowed down a bit as les blues took control of the game .
figo is looking a tad concerned as he waits for second half to begin .
45. min .
second half has started .
47. min .
henry gets a great chance !
the french striker gets a ball and starts a solo counter .
he goes past his defender and shoots outside the five meter line .
the ball is deflected to a corner by ricardo .
49. min .
france again !
zidane is having a good time making half the portugese team look like beginners and then passes the ball to ribery whose shot is saved by ricardo .
52. min .
ronaldo runs around with the ball but unlike first half his moves are inefficient .
53. min .
pauleta gets the ball inside the box for the first time .
the portugese striker turns and shoots into the left side of the net .
55. min .
a french counter started by henry sees ribery pass zidane outside the box where the french captain tries to direct the ball on to henry but it 's too hard .
57. min .
miguel is down but the cameras show he stumbles to the ground where he hangs out for a minute or two beefore being brought off the pitch .
he will probably be back soon .
60. min .
miguel is back but it does not look good .
61. min .
abidal gets a hard hit cross straight in the face outside the box .
the french defender is groggy and is helped off .
63. min .
miguel goes off for ferreira .
65. min .
the french are slowly backing home waiting for the counter and focusing on defending their lead .
68. min .
pauleta leaves for simao .
69. min .
malouda goes for wiltord .
70. min .
the portugese have not managed to create a lot so far in second half .
but the french are now deep into their own half and will probably feel some heat before the 90 minutes are over .
72. min .
ribery leaves for govou .
73. min .
the french now have all but henry on their own half .
the striker is hanging out in the mid circle waiting for the long ball .
75. min .
postiga comes on for costinha .
77. min .
portugal 's best chance .
ronaldo hits a free-kick from twentyfive meters that barthez ca n't hold .
the ball goes out to figo who has the whole goal to head the ball into but he is a bit late in his jump and the ball goes over the bar and lands in the net .
79. min .
the french are playing an ever more dangerous game as they do nothing but defend with no intentions to score the winner .
82. min .
carvalho is booked after a bad tackle on wiltord .
83. min .
figo wins a corner for portrugal but it 's poorly taken .
85. min .
henry goes off for saha .
86. min .
saha is booked and will not play in a possible final .
87. min .
the french have been extremely passive the last thirty minutes but there 's no question their tactics are effective .
89. min .
it also seems as if the portugese have half given up .
ronaldo is a shadow of his first half performance and deco has been invisible most of the game .
90 + 2. min .
meira gets the chance to shoot just outside the box but his half volley flies way high .
90 + 3. min .
a corner kick for portugal sees their goalie ricardo in the french box .
the portugese keeper manages a back kick that wins his team another corner .
90 + 4. min .
france are through and will play italy in the 2006 world cup final .
france 's tactics passed the test .
they stood firm at the back and gave the portugese few possibilities to come to a finish .
zidane gets his second final . send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic 9800 picture gallery daily highlights from the world cup the world cup in pictures a nation expects dw-world.de presents germany 's 2006 world cup squad .
klinsmann springs surprises in naming world cup squad germany world cup squad stadiums check out the 12 venues for the 2006 world cup .
world cup 2006 stadiums from the fringe have a laugh read about quirky happenings in thigh-slappin ' germany in this dw-world.de dossier .
visit germany exploring deutschland check out dw-world 's section with tips and reports from all parts of the country . © dw 2011 deutsche welle is not responsible for the content of external websites .

<p>
live ticker : portugal 0:1 france -pipe- match reports -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 05.07.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 02.04.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 05.07.2006 live ticker : portugal 0:1 france review all the action as it happened on dw-world.de 's live ticker . clash of the titans soccer legends luis figo and zinedine zidane both want the chance for one more game - and win - after tonight 's match against each other to end their careers on a high note .
the two men , both of whom had actually retired from international soccer once already , have said this world cup will be their final major tournament .
whoever wins in munich will play italy in berlin for soccer 's greatest prize .
tonight 's teams .
portugal -lrb- 4-5-1 -rrb- : 1-ricardo ; 13-miguel , 16-ricardo carvalho , 5-fernando meira , 14-nuno valente ; 6-costinha , 18-maniche , 20-deco , 7-luis figo , 17-cristiano ronaldo ; 9-pauleta coach : luiz felipe scolari france -lrb- 4-2-3-1 -rrb- : 16-fabien barthez ; 19-willy sagnol , 15-lilian thuram , 5-william gallas , 3-eric abidal ; 4-patrick vieira , 6-claude makelele ; 22-franck ribery , 10-zinedine zidane , 7-florent malouda ; 12-thierry henry coach : raymond domenech referee : jorge larrionda -lrb- uruguay -rrb- ten minutes to kick-off in munich .
the stadium is almost full .
lots of portugese blood red and french blue in the stands .
the teams are waiting in the tunnel .
the teams are walking in .
the two captains and real team mates - zidane and figo - look focused and have no time for friendly conversation .
cristiano ronaldo smiles as the portugese anthem begins .
does he know something we do n't ?
the camera sets on zidane for the french anthem .
will it be his last game today , or will he play a second world cup final ?
portugal win the toss .
1. min .
the game is on .
france kick off .
1. min .
malouda gets the first chance as he gets the ball from henry .
his shot is not clean and goes wide .
2. min .
ronaldo comes with good pace along the left wing but is stopped ten meters before the box .
4. min .
good chance for portugal .
ronaldo flies down the wing again and passes into deco outside the box who shoots .
barthez deflects with one hand and pauleta is blocked from hitting the ball into the french goal .
6. min .
the teams are taking turns playing their way to the box .
portugal are a bit faster but the french also combine well .
8. min .
ronaldo has started the game at top speed .
again he approaches the box bit this time flicks the ball backwards to maniche whose shot is only a foot over the bar .
9. min .
in the next attack , figo gets a low cross in that gallas manages to get a foot on .
11. min .
the portugese have had the better chances so far and the french have made unusually many mistakes in the first ten minutes .
13. min .
good combination by the french ends up dangerously close to henry 's foot .
ribery , zidane and abidal play the ball around and the latter gets the cross in that is not more than half a meter away from henry 's foot as he storms towards the far post .
15. min .
figo goes towards the box and is forced to shoot as pauleta is in an off-side position .
the shot is too weak and no problem for barthez .
18. min .
portugal have lost the pressure they had although the french are quite passive at the moment .
20. min .
makelele finds ribery with a lovely pass .
ribery passes to henry at the box line who tries a shot but hits a portugese defender .
23. min .
portugal bite themselves into the french half and ronaldo is the key as they combine but to little result .
25. min .
both teams are all but effective when they reach the box .
most of the time is spent passing within the team at midfield as if they need to build up confidence .
28. min .
henry gets the ball deep in the box to the left and dribbles past his defender to move in .
he flicks the ball towards the center but ricardo is first on the ball .
30. min .
the french defense seem to be warm and it 's getting increasingly more difficult for the portugese to come to any attempts at goal .
31. min .
penalty for france 33. min .
goal france and zidane ! ! 33. min .
henry is the one who wins the penalty as he gets brought down just inside the box but with free range to the goal .
zidane takes two steps back and shows all english players how to beat ricardo .
36. min .
maniche tries a long shot from twenty five meters and barthez does not look the most convincing as he struggles to hold on to the ball .
38. min .
ronaldo moves in from the right and shoots just inside the box .
a good shot that is deflected to a corner .
the young portugese has been the most prolific player on the pitch so far .
41. min .
the french are very disciplined and now control the pace of the game .
43. min .
ronaldo again .
this time he comes down the right and shoots outside the box .
the shot is wide though .
45 + 1. min .
first half is over .
the portugese are pushing on hoping for the equalizer but with no luck .
a quite good first half where the portugese started off at high pace but the french defense soon found their rhythm .
after the french goal the tempo slowed down a bit as les blues took control of the game .
figo is looking a tad concerned as he waits for second half to begin .
45. min .
second half has started .
47. min .
henry gets a great chance !
the french striker gets a ball and starts a solo counter .
he goes past his defender and shoots outside the five meter line .
the ball is deflected to a corner by ricardo .
49. min .
france again !
zidane is having a good time making half the portugese team look like beginners and then passes the ball to ribery whose shot is saved by ricardo .
52. min .
ronaldo runs around with the ball but unlike first half his moves are inefficient .
53. min .
pauleta gets the ball inside the box for the first time .
the portugese striker turns and shoots into the left side of the net .
55. min .
a french counter started by henry sees ribery pass zidane outside the box where the french captain tries to direct the ball on to henry but it 's too hard .
57. min .
miguel is down but the cameras show he stumbles to the ground where he hangs out for a minute or two beefore being brought off the pitch .
he will probably be back soon .
60. min .
miguel is back but it does not look good .
61. min .
abidal gets a hard hit cross straight in the face outside the box .
the french defender is groggy and is helped off .
63. min .
miguel goes off for ferreira .
65. min .
the french are slowly backing home waiting for the counter and focusing on defending their lead .
68. min .
pauleta leaves for simao .
69. min .
malouda goes for wiltord .
70. min .
the portugese have not managed to create a lot so far in second half .
but the french are now deep into their own half and will probably feel some heat before the 90 minutes are over .
72. min .
ribery leaves for govou .
73. min .
the french now have all but henry on their own half .
the striker is hanging out in the mid circle waiting for the long ball .
75. min .
postiga comes on for costinha .
77. min .
portugal 's best chance .
ronaldo hits a free-kick from twentyfive meters that barthez ca n't hold .
the ball goes out to figo who has the whole goal to head the ball into but he is a bit late in his jump and the ball goes over the bar and lands in the net .
79. min .
the french are playing an ever more dangerous game as they do nothing but defend with no intentions to score the winner .
82. min .
carvalho is booked after a bad tackle on wiltord .
83. min .
figo wins a corner for portrugal but it 's poorly taken .
85. min .
henry goes off for saha .
86. min .
saha is booked and will not play in a possible final .
87. min .
the french have been extremely passive the last thirty minutes but there 's no question their tactics are effective .
89. min .
it also seems as if the portugese have half given up .
ronaldo is a shadow of his first half performance and deco has been invisible most of the game .
90 + 2. min .
meira gets the chance to shoot just outside the box but his half volley flies way high .
90 + 3. min .
a corner kick for portugal sees their goalie ricardo in the french box .
the portugese keeper manages a back kick that wins his team another corner .
90 + 4. min .
france are through and will play italy in the 2006 world cup final .
france 's tactics passed the test .
they stood firm at the back and gave the portugese few possibilities to come to a finish .
zidane gets his second final . send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic feedback send us an e-mail .
please include your name and country in your reply .
9800 picture gallery daily highlights from the world cup the world cup in pictures a nation expects dw-world.de presents germany 's 2006 world cup squad .
klinsmann springs surprises in naming world cup squad germany world cup squad stadiums check out the 12 venues for the 2006 world cup .
world cup 2006 stadiums from the fringe have a laugh read about quirky happenings in thigh-slappin ' germany in this dw-world.de dossier .
visit germany exploring deutschland check out dw-world 's section with tips and reports from all parts of the country . © dw 2011 deutsche welle is not responsible for the content of external websites .
